refined_description:
**Principal Engineer, Advanced Materials & Surface Technology**

**Location:** Global Innovation Hub (Remote/Hybrid options available)

**About Us:**
We are a visionary global leader committed to pushing the boundaries of technological innovation and aesthetic excellence. Our cutting-edge product portfolio is defined by superior quality and groundbreaking design, achieved through relentless research and development. We empower our teams to redefine industry benchmarks and drive the future of product development.

**Role Overview:**
We are seeking a highly accomplished and strategically-minded Principal Engineer to champion a dedicated team of elite engineers. This pivotal role is central to our ongoing commitment to pioneering the next generation of A-surface technologies, encompassing innovative in-mold decorative, advanced paint laser, and precision etching solutions. You will be instrumental in shaping the future aesthetic and functional integrity of our flagship products on a global scale.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic Leadership:** Lead, inspire, and mentor a high-performing engineering team, providing visionary technical direction and ensuring the successful execution of complex A-surface design and development projects.
*   **Market & Aesthetic Insight:** Serve as the principal subject matter expert, offering unparalleled insights into global surface decorating industry trends, meticulously interpreting evolving customer aesthetic demands, and translating these into groundbreaking product applications.
*   **Client Engagement & Advocacy:** Represent the organization as a key stakeholder in high-profile customer presentations and critical design review sessions, articulating complex technical concepts with clarity, strategic vision, and compelling advocacy.
*   **Materials Lifecycle Orchestration:** Orchestrate the comprehensive lifecycle management of advanced technical material requisitions, ensuring seamless integration with project timelines and adherence to rigorous quality benchmarks.
*   **Global Specification & Standardization:** Pioneer the identification and recommendation of cutting-edge resin and lubrication solutions for advanced BCS applications, meticulously establishing and championing global specifications for surface quality, resin performance, and lubrication efficacy across all product lines.
*   **Cost Optimization & Performance Enhancement:** Drive strategic initiatives for robust cost optimization and enhanced product performance through the rigorous evaluation and judicious selection of next-generation polymers and innovative additives.
*   **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Collaborate synergistically with the Global Value Analysis and Value Engineering (VAVE) team, providing expert guidance in the identification and validation of alternative, high-impact cost-effective material recommendations.
*   **Supplier Partnership & Innovation:** Cultivate and leverage strategic partnerships with premier resin suppliers, engaging in advanced consultations to unearth novel VAVE alternatives and transformative material solutions.
*   **Market Intelligence & Qualification:** Conduct comprehensive market intelligence and due diligence on global resin suppliers, meticulously assessing their automotive industry approvals, and facilitating the streamlined process for new material qualification and adoption.

**Qualifications:**

*   Master’s or Ph.D. in Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Polymer Engineering, or a closely related discipline.
*   Minimum of 10-12 years of progressive experience in A-surface design, advanced materials engineering, or related fields within a highly regulated industry, preferably automotive or consumer electronics.
*   Demonstrated track record of leading and inspiring high-caliber engineering teams to deliver impactful, innovative solutions.
*   Profound expertise in polymer science, surface chemistry, decorative technologies (in-mold, laser etching, painting), and lubrication systems.
*   Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
*   Strategic mindset with a proven ability to translate complex technical challenges into actionable, high-impact solutions.
*   Global experience and a nuanced understanding of international material specifications and regulatory landscapes.

**Why Join Us?**
This is an unparalleled opportunity to shape the future of our product portfolio and leave an indelible mark on the industry. You will be at the forefront of innovation, working with cutting-edge technologies in a dynamic, collaborative, and globally connected environment. We offer a culture that fosters professional autonomy, encourages groundbreaking exploration, and supports continuous, unparalleled professional growth.

**Application Process:**
Qualified candidates are invited to submit a comprehensive resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience and strategic vision.

If you are driven by the opportunity to make a transformative impact and contribute to a culture of continuous innovation, we invite you to submit your comprehensive portfolio and resume for consideration.

refined_description:
**Instrument & Control Systems Technician | Critical Infrastructure Operations, Bakersfield, CA**

Join a leading team dedicated to ensuring the reliability and peak performance of critical power generation assets. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Instrument & Control Systems Technician to contribute to our sophisticated operational environment. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on our infrastructure’s integrity and efficiency.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Lead calibration, testing, maintenance, and installation of complex instrumentation, control systems, and electrical infrastructure within a dynamic power generation environment.
*   Execute comprehensive maintenance protocols for critical operational components including motor control centers, actuated valves, generators, and excitation systems.
*   Drive proactive and reactive maintenance initiatives, collaborating cross-functionally to optimize asset performance and reliability.
*   Contribute to the design and seamless integration of new equipment and system enhancements.
*   Diagnose and resolve complex issues across DC power systems, advanced process controls, PLC networks, and environmental monitoring instrumentation.
*   Maintain meticulous documentation within the computerized maintenance management system (CMMS), ensuring comprehensive historical records for strategic decision-making.
*   Act as a key liaison with external vendors and specialized contractors, overseeing project execution and quality assurance.
*   Champion a culture of safety, proactively identifying potential hazards and implementing robust mitigation strategies.
*   Ensure stringent adherence to environmental compliance standards, contributing to sustainable operational practices.
*   Collaborate extensively across departments, providing essential technical expertise to achieve overarching organizational performance objectives.
*   Mentor and upskill colleagues in advanced instrumentation, control, and electrical systems, fostering collective technical proficiency.
*   Maintain an impeccably organized and efficient work environment.
*   Oversee meticulous equipment and system tagging protocols in strict adherence to regulatory standards.
*   Conduct rigorous safety inspections and maintain precise compliance records.
*   Engage in facility enhancement projects, contributing technical insights to new installations.
*   Expertly interpret complex engineering schematics, blueprints, and technical specifications.
*   Manage critical inventory and procurement processes for essential components to ensure operational continuity.
*   Demonstrate adaptability by undertaking diverse operational assignments and special projects as necessitated by critical business objectives.
*   Exhibit a commitment to operational excellence through availability for critical on-call support and extended hours as required to maintain continuous power generation.

**Qualifications:**

*   Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, capable of influencing outcomes and fostering collaborative team environments.
*   Proven ability to strategically coordinate complex technical projects across multidisciplinary teams.
*   Flexibility to accommodate a dynamic work schedule, including rotational shifts, weekends, and holidays, is essential for this critical role.

title: Technician Instrument & Controls
description: Technician Instrument & ControlsLocation Deweyville, TXLocation Name: NRG Cottonwood EnergyCategory: MaintenanceState/City: US-TX-DeweyvilleType: Full Time Hourly# Openings: 1Details About this Career Opportunity:Overview:Company Profile:We deliver cleaner and smarter energy choices for our customers, backed by the nation’s largest independent power generation portfolio of fossil fuel, nuclear, solar and wind facilities. A Fortune 500 company is challenging the U.S. energy industry by becoming the largest developer of solar power, building the first privately-funded electric vehicle charging infrastructure, and providing customers with the most advanced smart energy solutions to better manage their energy use. In addition to 47,000 megawatts of generation capacity, enough to supply nearly 40 million homes, our retail electricity providers serve more than two million customers.GENERAL SUMMARYThe Instrumentation Controls and Electrical Technician (IC&E) is responsible for the maintenance and repair of all instruments, control systems and electrical equipment in the power plant and the associated facilities. The IC&E Technician performs work of high skill in the inspection repair, testing, adjustment, installation and removal of all electronic and electrical power plant equipment and systems.PRIMARY FUNCTIONS-Safely perform preventive and corrective maintenance on all plant equipment, systems, and emergency backup systems.-Maintain complete equipment files, logs, and drawings for all designated equipment.-Assist in maintaining and controlling spare parts inventory to maintain plant reliability. Assist in physical inventories.-Participate in the administrative maintenance of the plant operating manuals, technical references, prints and diagrams and preventive/predictive maintenance records.-Inspect repair, install and remove all types of motors, generators, transformers, switches, control equipment, wiring, electrical signal and communication systems, and storage batteries, and work with electrical systems up to and including 4160 volts.-Conduct trouble shooting and analysis on DCS, PLC and GE Mark VI turbine control equipment.-Maintain all plant instrumentation and electrical test equipment.-Fully support and participate in NAES Safety and Regulatory Compliance Programs.-Complete other tasks as assigned by the Maintenance Manager or the Plant Manager.SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITYThe IC&E Technician operates from established and well-known procedures under minimum supervision, performing duties independently with only general direction given. Decisions are made within prescribed operating and casualty procedures and guidelines. The ICE Technician encounters recurring work situations of high complexity, with occasional variations from the norm.The IC&E Technician must perform work in a safe manner resulting in no accidents, in compliance with all environmental permits at all times. The ICE Technician must effectively communicate information to supervision and fellow plant personnel, relative to the condition of the plant equipment and performance, and provide suggestions for plant improvements. The ICE Technician must perform duties in such a way to result in an optimum cost-benefit ratio.The IC&E Technician may also be assigned the additional responsibility of Maintenance Coordinator/Planner for the site. This is a collateral assignment given to a selected maintenance department technician to assist the Operations and Maintenance Manager with the routine planning and coordination of the site equipment maintenance.The duties include:-The planning and review of the preventative, predictive and pro-active type maintenance.-A more in-depth knowledge and ability to use the CMMS system to provide the necessary review and planning to support the O&M Manager in weekly work routines.-Ability to provide the cognitive coordinated efforts necessary to ensure that weekly routines and preventative maintenance are scheduled and documented as complete when the respective maintenance technician indicates that the work has been performed.-Provide the coordination efforts necessary in support of allowing the O&M Manager to provide the necessary supervision and direction of the maintenance technicians.All employees have the responsibility to both the customer and their co-workers to do the job right the first time and to ensure the customers' needs are being met.
benefits: we are a team of almost 8,000 employees who help power almost 40 million homes and have more than 2 million residential and business customers across the country. Together, we are powering progress every day—from California to Texas and New Jersey to Arizona.
refined_description:
**Senior Systems Engineer, Instrumentation & Controls (IC&E)**

**Location:** Deweyville, TX
**Category:** Operational Excellence
**Type:** Full-Time, Salaried

**About Our Organization:**
We are a Fortune 500 global energy leader, committed to pioneering cleaner, smarter, and more sustainable energy solutions for millions of customers. Our expansive portfolio encompasses the nation's largest independent power generation assets, integrating cutting-edge fossil fuel, nuclear, solar, and wind technologies. We are fundamentally reshaping the U.S. energy landscape, driving innovation as a premier developer of renewable energy infrastructure and providing advanced smart energy solutions that empower our diverse clientele. Join a team at the forefront of energy evolution.

**Role Summary:**
The Senior Systems Engineer, Instrumentation & Controls (IC&E) is a pivotal contributor to ensuring the optimal performance, reliability, and advanced functionality of our critical power generation assets. This role is instrumental in orchestrating sophisticated diagnostic evaluations, precision calibrations, and strategic deployment of cutting-edge electronic and electrical power plant equipment and systems, maintaining operational integrity across complex industrial environments.

**Key Responsibilities:**
*   Proactively drive the execution of advanced preventive, predictive, and corrective maintenance protocols on all plant equipment, control systems, and emergency backup infrastructure, ensuring peak operational efficiency and uncompromising safety standards.
*   Orchestrate comprehensive information management systems, including meticulous equipment documentation, operational logs, and technical schematics, ensuring data integrity and accessibility.
*   Strategically contribute to the optimization and oversight of critical spare parts inventory management, enhancing plant reliability and resource efficiency.
*   Actively engage in the stewardship of our intellectual assets, encompassing intricate operational manuals, technical references, engineering diagrams, and sophisticated maintenance records.
*   Execute the comprehensive assessment, restoration, and seamless integration of diverse high-voltage electrical apparatus (up to 4160 volts), including motors, generators, transformers, switching gear, advanced control units, intricate wiring networks, and sophisticated communication systems.
*   Pioneer advanced troubleshooting and deep-dive analytical diagnostics on complex Distributed Control Systems (DCS), Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), and proprietary turbine control platforms.
*   Ensure the precision calibration and optimal functionality of all critical plant instrumentation and specialized electrical diagnostic equipment.
*   Champion adherence to rigorous safety protocols and stringent regulatory compliance frameworks, fostering a culture of operational excellence and responsibility.
*   Undertake strategic initiatives and special projects as directed by leadership, contributing to broader departmental and organizational objectives.

**Scope of Influence & Impact:**
This role operates with significant autonomy within a framework of advanced procedural guidelines, demonstrating exceptional independent judgment and initiative. Strategic decisions are informed by a deep understanding of operational protocols and critical incident response frameworks. The Senior Systems Engineer thrives in dynamic, high-complexity environments, adept at navigating nuanced challenges and architecting innovative solutions. You will uphold an unwavering commitment to operational excellence, ensuring an impeccable safety record and steadfast adherence to all environmental stewardship mandates. You will cultivate highly effective communication channels, distilling complex technical insights for both peer collaboration and executive reporting, while proactively identifying and championing strategic enhancements for plant optimization and superior cost-benefit outcomes.

Exceptional performers may be afforded the distinct opportunity for accelerated career progression, including potential selection for a collateral assignment as a **Maintenance Coordinator/Planner**, a pivotal role designed to prepare individuals for future leadership within our operational framework. This strategic assignment involves close collaboration with the Operations and Maintenance Leadership, orchestrating sophisticated planning and seamless coordination of site-wide asset lifecycle management. Responsibilities include spearheading the strategic planning and rigorous oversight of preventive, predictive, and proactive maintenance programs. Leveraging advanced CMMS capabilities, this role provides comprehensive analytical support for weekly operational planning, ensuring meticulous scheduling, execution, and documentation of all critical maintenance activities. This assignment serves as a direct conduit for enabling executive oversight and strategic direction for our highly skilled technical teams.

Every member of our team is empowered to uphold the highest standards of quality and service, ensuring superior outcomes for both our esteemed clientele and internal stakeholders.

**Application Process:**
To explore this unparalleled opportunity and contribute to our transformative mission, please submit your comprehensive professional profile through our dedicated careers portal.

title: Senior Engineering Product Manager
description: Senior Engineering Product ManagerAs a member of the Service Provider Engineering team, you will be responsible for managing the development of broadband DSL products targeted at service providers that provide Home Gateway, voice gateways, wireless adapters, IPTV and Voice over IP (VoIP) services. These products will incorporate one or several of the following technologies: DSL, Routers, 802.11 Wireless, VPN, Firewalls.  The primary function of an engineering product manager is project management and technical oversight. The individual manages the ODM to ensure that products are delivered in a timely fashion to a high quality and in accordance with the procedures and systems. In addition the individual oversees the activities between the component vendors and the ODM. Within the service provider group, another important project management aspect is working with the sales engineers to get products approved at service providers. The individual must manage the technical issues that arise during the approval process and ensure a rapid resolution by working with and through the sales engineers, ODMs and Component vendors. A word from the Recruiter: "Some of the exciting things that retain engineers here are the new technologies that we integrate into our products. Most People hear about these technologies 9 months after the product development has launched, our engineers actually start learning about the new technologies in advance of any silicon introductions. In most cases, we are an early partner to silicon vendors and help guide the silicon features. This is extremely rare for many of the new members, once they do the first project they want more and more. As you can imagine the value of that engineer is much greater then when they walked in the door." "Most engineers that I interview have been disappointed by their employers, and when asked how much ownership they have of the product they developed, the answer is always something like : I only did this this portion of the software, or some portion of the chip, or some portion of the hardware. Not much of an empowerment here.  Here, the PE is the complete owner of every molecule of the product, including mechanical, operation, finance, cost, etc. This empowerment is another added value boost an engineer could benefit from, this value is rare and will push the engineer in the direction of someday running a business end to end with a larger responsibility and scope. The more of these projects they take the faster they reach that level of career growth and maturity." This is what not shared on the JD. "How you will mature your career." Job Responsibilities: • For assigned projects, take overall responsibility for delivering the product to production; including requirements generation, hardware, firmware, documentation, regulatory testing and Agile release requirements, per Netgear policies. It is expected that projects should be managed with minimal supervision. • Project management. Develop and maintain project plans. Keep all stakeholders informed of product status at all times• Project Execution. Manage the suppliers' (ODM, chip vendor, etc.) product development process. • Product Verification. Manage verification testing of product features and performance. • Customer Certification. Manage qualification of products with customers.• Documentation. Provide input for manuals, help files, application notes, marketing materials and tech support.• Support. Resolve any 3 rd level technical support escalations. • Track industry technology developments, supplier roadmaps, standards bodies and make product recommendations
benefits: What is offered:Broad responsibility, autonomy and visibility in an Engineering role.In-depth exposure to real-world customer issues across a global customer baseSmall-company feel in a growth environmentOpportunity for executive advancementVery competitive compensation packageSignificant stake in equity, stock optionsAttractive bonus programFull benefits package including generous retirement contributionsOpportunity for executive advancementReputable, renowned world-class leadership*Offering $1,000 Referral Bonus for each successful referral.Please contact: Darren Lawson directly at: #PHONE_90d33c9d7ec1484aebfe37b153d677decc6f5f53b316489ed24061544c04eb66# or #EMAIL_f4da338e899ddba983ac771b001681d1d2d93b3327ddc420a15f4e5a310071a9# #URL_99f46a2efd6ad483a11b40eef7a406a29de60d77be6dcb56289f26bd039c1017#
refined_description:
**Senior Engineering Product Manager**

Join our pioneering Service Provider Engineering team, where you will be at the forefront of shaping the next generation of broadband communication products. This pivotal role offers an exceptional opportunity to drive innovation and strategic product development within a dynamic, high-impact environment.

As a **Senior Engineering Product Manager**, you will assume comprehensive ownership of complex broadband DSL product lines, encompassing Home Gateway, Voice Gateways, Wireless Adapters, IPTV, and Voice over IP (VoIP) services. These cutting-edge solutions integrate sophisticated technologies including DSL, Routers, 802.11 Wireless, VPN, and Firewalls. Your primary mission will be to exercise strategic technical oversight and robust project leadership, ensuring the timely and high-quality delivery of transformative products to market.

This role distinguishes itself by offering:

*   **Pioneering Technology Engagement:** Gain unparalleled early access to nascent silicon and emerging technologies, actively influencing the feature sets and architectural direction of future industry standards. Your contributions will guide the very evolution of broadband infrastructure, placing you at the vanguard of innovation months before widespread industry adoption.
*   **Holistic Product Stewardship:** Embrace complete end-to-end accountability for product success, from initial concept through to mass production and post-launch support. This includes meticulous management of hardware, firmware, documentation, regulatory compliance, and Agile release cycles. You will navigate the full spectrum of product lifecycle challenges, exercising significant autonomy and strategic influence over technical, operational, and financial outcomes.
*   **Accelerated Career Progression:** This role is meticulously designed for individuals poised for rapid professional advancement. You will cultivate a unique blend of technical expertise, strategic leadership, and business acumen, accelerating your trajectory towards executive-level responsibilities and enterprise-wide leadership within a short timeframe.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic Product Realization:** Take singular responsibility for the end-to-end delivery of assigned products to production, operating with a high degree of autonomy in defining requirements, overseeing development, and ensuring adherence to stringent quality standards.
*   **Advanced Project Governance:** Develop, maintain, and champion comprehensive project plans and roadmaps, ensuring seamless communication and alignment across all internal and external stakeholders.
*   **Global Supplier Ecosystem Management:** Expertly manage product development processes with Original Design Manufacturers (ODMs) and key component vendors, optimizing efficiency and resolving complex technical challenges.
*   **Rigorous Verification & Validation:** Direct and oversee comprehensive product verification and performance testing to ensure features exceed specifications and market expectations.
*   **Client Integration & Certification:** Lead the qualification and certification processes with strategic service provider clients, expertly navigating technical hurdles and ensuring swift resolution in collaboration with sales engineering teams and partners.
*   **Authoritative Documentation & Enablement:** Provide critical input for technical manuals, help files, application notes, marketing collateral, and technical support resources, ensuring clarity and accuracy.
*   **Elite Technical Resolution:** Act as a definitive escalation point for highly complex 3rd-level technical support issues, delivering swift and expert resolutions.
*   **Visionary Market Intelligence:** Continuously monitor industry technological advancements, evaluate supplier roadmaps, and synthesize insights to propose innovative product recommendations that maintain market leadership.

We seek a professional who thrives in an environment of high empowerment and significant impact. If you are ready to own your career trajectory and shape the future of connectivity, we encourage you to apply.

title: Lead Mechanical Engineer
description: Corporate overviewAker Solutions is a global provider of products, systems and services to the oil and gas industry. Our engineering, design and technology bring discoveries into production and maximize recovery from each petroleum field. We employ approximately 28,000 people in about 30 countries. Go to #URL_0fa3f7c5e23a16de16a841e368006cae916884407d90b154dfef3976483a71ae# for more information on our business, people and values.We are looking for individuals who are prepared to take a position. Not only a position within Aker Solutions, but also a position on the exciting challenges the global oil and gas industry faces now and in the future.We are looking for a Lead Mechanical Engineer to join our team in Houston, Texas.The Lead Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for providing expertise and technical leadership to the organization.Responsibilities and tasks• Performs mechanical calculations and technical analysis on various custom components and reviews mechanical design of equipment to ensure that specifications are met;• Prepares and presents complex technical reports, equipment data sheets, MRQ’s, TBE’s and MRP’s, and makes recommendations on critical engineering issues;• Work with certifying agencies for product development and follows through with ABSA registrations;• Leads and reviews project design decisions, budgets, and scheduling;• Identifies solutions to achieve company objectives and ensure that the team is aligned.• Interfaces directly with the customer and participates in preparing bids and proposals;• Ensure processes are followed correctly and continuously identifies opportunities to improve efficiencies;• Ensure team members are kept current on procedure QMS changes;• Provides leadership, technical guidance and mentor-ship to other engineers.
benefits: We offer• Friendly colleagues in an industry with a bright future.• An environment where you are encouraged to develop your skills and share your knowledge with your colleagues.• Competitive benefits and strong focus on work-life balance.
refined_description:
**Lead Mechanical Engineer**

**About Aker Solutions:**

Aker Solutions stands as a prominent global force, dedicated to delivering transformative products, systems, and services within the dynamic oil and gas sector. Our distinctive blend of innovative engineering, sophisticated design, and pioneering technology empowers the seamless transition of discoveries into productive assets, maximizing recovery potential from critical petroleum fields worldwide. With a diverse workforce of approximately 28,000 professionals spanning nearly 30 countries, we are at the forefront of tackling the industry's most compelling challenges. Discover more about our visionary operations, dedicated people, and core values by visiting [Insert Placeholder URL or retain original if desired].

We are seeking exceptional individuals who are not only prepared to assume a pivotal role within Aker Solutions but are also eager to contribute meaningfully to the evolving landscape and strategic imperatives facing the global energy industry.

**The Opportunity:**

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and strategic **Lead Mechanical Engineer** to join our elite team in Houston, Texas. This critical role demands a visionary leader capable of providing unparalleled technical expertise and driving organizational excellence through impactful leadership.

**Key Responsibilities and Strategic Contributions:**

*   Drive precision engineering analyses and perform comprehensive mechanical calculations on a diverse portfolio of custom components, meticulously validating equipment designs against stringent specifications.
*   Architect and articulate comprehensive technical reports, equipment data sheets, Material Requisition Quotations (MRQs), Technical Bid Evaluations (TBEs), and Material Requisition Plans (MRPs), offering strategic recommendations on mission-critical engineering issues.
*   Spearhead regulatory compliance and certification initiatives, actively engaging with certifying agencies for product development and ensuring adherence to critical registrations, including ABSA.

title: Technician Instrument & Controls
description: Technician Instrument & ControlsLocation Deweyville, TXLocation Name: NRG Cottonwood EnergyCategory: MaintenanceState/City: US-TX-DeweyvilleType: Full Time Hourly# Openings: 1Details About this Career Opportunity:Overview:Company Profile:We deliver cleaner and smarter energy choices for our customers, backed by the nation’s largest independent power generation portfolio of fossil fuel, nuclear, solar and wind facilities. A Fortune 500 company is challenging the U.S. energy industry by becoming the largest developer of solar power, building the first privately-funded electric vehicle charging infrastructure, and providing customers with the most advanced smart energy solutions to better manage their energy use. In addition to 47,000 megawatts of generation capacity, enough to supply nearly 40 million homes, our retail electricity providers serve more than two million customers.GENERAL SUMMARYThe Instrumentation Controls and Electrical Technician (IC&E) is responsible for the maintenance and repair of all instruments, control systems and electrical equipment in the power plant and the associated facilities. The IC&E Technician performs work of high skill in the inspection repair, testing, adjustment, installation and removal of all electronic and electrical power plant equipment and systems.PRIMARY FUNCTIONS- Safely perform preventive and corrective maintenance on all plant equipment, systems, and emergency backup systems.- Maintain complete equipment files, logs, and drawings for all designated equipment.- Assist in maintaining and controlling spare parts inventory to maintain plant reliability. Assist in physical inventories.- Participate in the administrative maintenance of the plant operating manuals, technical references, prints and diagrams and preventive/predictive maintenance records.- Inspect repair, install and remove all types of motors, generators, transformers, switches, control equipment, wiring, electrical signal and communication systems, and storage batteries, and work with electrical systems up to and including 4160 volts.- Conduct trouble shooting and analysis on DCS, PLC and GE Mark VI turbine control equipment.- Maintain all plant instrumentation and electrical test equipment.- Fully support and participate in NAES Safety and Regulatory Compliance Programs.- Complete other tasks as assigned by the Maintenance Manager or the Plant Manager.SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITYThe IC&E Technician operates from established and well-known procedures under minimum supervision, performing duties independently with only general direction given. Decisions are made within prescribed operating and casualty procedures and guidelines. The ICE Technician encounters recurring work situations of high complexity, with occasional variations from the norm.The IC&E Technician must perform work in a safe manner resulting in no accidents, in compliance with all environmental permits at all times. The ICE Technician must effectively communicate information to supervision and fellow plant personnel, relative to the condition of the plant equipment and performance, and provide suggestions for plant improvements. The ICE Technician must perform duties in such a way to result in an optimum cost-benefit ratio.The IC&E Technician may also be assigned the additional responsibility of Maintenance Coordinator/Planner for the site. This is a collateral assignment given to a selected maintenance department technician to assist the Operations and Maintenance Manager with the routine planning and coordination of the site equipment maintenance.The duties include:- The planning and review of the preventative, predictive and pro-active type maintenance.- A more in-depth knowledge and ability to use the CMMS system to provide the necessary review and planning to support the O&M Manager in weekly work routines.- Ability to provide the cognitive coordinated efforts necessary to ensure that weekly routines and preventative maintenance are scheduled and documented as complete when the respective maintenance technician indicates that the work has been performed.- Provide the coordination efforts necessary in support of allowing the O&M Manager to provide the necessary supervision and direction of the maintenance technicians.All employees have the responsibility to both the customer and their co-workers to do the job right the first time and to ensure the customers' needs are being met.
benefits: we are a team of almost 8,000 employees who help power almost 40 million homes and have more than 2 million residential and business customers across the country. Together, we are powering progress every day—from California to Texas and New Jersey to Arizona.
refined_description:
**Lead Instrumentation & Controls Specialist**

**Location:** Deweyville, TX
**Category:** Technical Operations
**Type:** Full-Time, Hourly

**Discover a Transformative Career Opportunity:**

**Company Overview:**
Join a Fortune 500 industry leader at the forefront of the nation’s energy landscape. We are redefining the future of sustainable and intelligent power generation, leveraging the largest independent portfolio spanning conventional, nuclear, solar, and wind technologies. Our commitment extends beyond generation, pioneering innovations such as privately-funded electric vehicle infrastructure and advanced smart energy solutions for millions of retail customers. With a formidable capacity poised to power nearly 40 million homes, we offer a dynamic environment where groundbreaking technology meets critical infrastructure.

**Role Summary:**
The Instrumentation, Controls, and Electrical (IC&E) Specialist plays a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless operation and optimal performance of our advanced control systems, precision instrumentation, and critical electrical infrastructure within a sophisticated power generation facility. This position demands a highly skilled professional capable of executing complex technical operations, diagnostics, and maintenance protocols to uphold unparalleled operational integrity and efficiency.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Execute advanced preventative and corrective maintenance protocols on a comprehensive range of plant equipment, intricate control systems, and emergency backup architectures.
*   Ensure meticulous documentation and integrity of all equipment records, technical specifications, and system schematics, contributing to robust data management.
*   Contribute to strategic inventory management, optimizing resource allocation for sustained operational resilience and timely component availability.
*   Engage in the systematic upkeep and enhancement of operational manuals, technical references, and predictive/preventative maintenance documentation.
*   Perform expert inspection, repair, installation, and decommissioning of diverse electrical components, from industrial motors and transformers to high-voltage systems (up to 4160 volts).
*   Lead complex diagnostic initiatives and advanced troubleshooting for sophisticated Distributed Control Systems (DCS), Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), and proprietary turbine control platforms (e.g., GE Mark VI).
*   Oversee the calibration and maintenance of precision instrumentation and electrical testing apparatus, ensuring diagnostic accuracy and operational reliability.
*   Champion adherence to rigorous safety protocols and stringent regulatory compliance frameworks, contributing to a culture of operational excellence and incident prevention.
*   Undertake strategic ad-hoc assignments as directed by leadership, contributing to overall departmental objectives and continuous improvement initiatives.

**Scope of Influence:**

The IC&E Specialist thrives in an autonomous capacity, operating within a framework of best practices and established protocols, while exercising significant independent judgment. This role demands astute decision-making within critical operational parameters and contingency frameworks, navigating recurring scenarios of pronounced technical complexity and adeptly adapting to dynamic operational variables.

Demonstrating an unwavering commitment to safety and environmental stewardship is paramount, ensuring impeccable compliance with all regulatory mandates and fostering an incident-free environment. The Specialist fosters transparent and effective communication channels, providing critical insights into equipment performance and contributing proactive recommendations for system optimization. Responsibilities are executed with a keen focus on operational efficiency and fiscal prudence, driving optimal cost-benefit outcomes.

This role may also evolve to encompass critical project coordination and strategic planning responsibilities, serving as a key liaison to the Operations and Maintenance Leadership. This may include:

*   Orchestrating and meticulously reviewing preventative, predictive, and proactive maintenance strategies.
*   Leveraging advanced proficiency in Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS) to facilitate insightful analysis and optimize workstream planning.
*   Providing astute coordination to ensure seamless execution and meticulous documentation of all scheduled maintenance routines.
*   Facilitating a streamlined operational cadence, empowering the Maintenance Leadership to provide strategic oversight and guidance to the technical team.

Every team member is integral to our commitment to unparalleled excellence, ensuring the highest standards of delivery and unwavering client satisfaction.

refined_description:
**Environmental Stewardship & Compliance Lead**

**Location:** Bakersfield, CA

We are seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented **Environmental Stewardship & Compliance Lead** to join our dynamic Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) team. This pivotal role is central to our commitment to operational excellence and sustainable growth, driving the integration of robust environmental compliance strategies with our core business objectives. We seek an individual passionate about environmental leadership, eager to share expertise, and committed to continuous professional development within our evolving organizational landscape.

**Work Environment:**
This position operates within diverse and challenging environments, encompassing corporate office settings, field operations, drilling sites, production facilities, and construction projects. The successful candidate will navigate varied working conditions, which may include exposure to temperature extremes, dust, oil, and other operational elements. This role requires resilience and adaptability in dynamic operational settings.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Orchestrate the development and deployment of comprehensive environmental programs, ensuring stringent adherence to all applicable regulatory frameworks.
*   Lead the strategic implementation and continuous enhancement of ISO 14001 Environmental Management Systems across all operational facets.
*   Author sophisticated analytical reports, policy documents, and critical regulatory submissions, demonstrating exceptional clarity, precision, and adherence to professional standards.
*   Manage critical environmental data within advanced enterprise systems, ensuring data integrity, facilitating insightful analysis, and supporting strategic decision-making.
*   Champion a culture of proactive environmental stewardship and safety, fostering a shared commitment to best practices among all stakeholders.
*   Serve as the principal liaison and subject matter expert, cultivating robust relationships with internal teams, external contractors, consultants, and key regulatory authorities.
*   Drive the execution and continuous optimization of the Environmental Compliance Action Plan, ensuring proactive risk mitigation and performance improvement.
*   Oversee the meticulous management of environmental records, establishing systems that exceed regulatory mandates and optimize resource utilization.
*   Conduct rigorous Process Hazard Analyses and lead comprehensive investigations into environmental incidents, driving preventative strategies and fostering a learning culture.
*   Lead diverse environmental projects from inception to completion, providing transparent and timely communication on progress, challenges, and critical insights.
*   Facilitate strategic engagements and collaborative forums with internal personnel and external partners to foster continuous improvement in environmental performance.
*   Direct and execute comprehensive environmental inspections, rigorous audits, and sophisticated sampling protocols.
*   Develop and ensure the robust delivery of essential environmental training programs across the organization.
*   Contribute significantly to the meticulous preparation and timely submission of all required agency reports and permits.
*   Analyze emerging environmental regulatory changes, assessing their profound impact on business operations and informing strategic adaptations.
*   Pioneer initiatives for continuous improvement and advance leading-edge environmental sustainability systems.
*   Actively contribute to and influence the strategic direction of the HES Committee, driving organizational excellence.

**Application Process:**
Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit their applications exclusively through our official careers portal. Direct email inquiries and phone calls are not being considered at this time. We appreciate your cooperation. Recruitment agencies are kindly requested to refrain from submitting unsolicited resumes.

refined_description:
**Montcalm Luxury Hotel London**
34-40 Great Cumberland Pl, Marble Arch, London W1H 7TW, United Kingdom

**Exceptional Opportunities for Dedicated Professionals**

Montcalm Luxury Hotel London, a prestigious five-star establishment renowned for its unparalleled service and exquisite guest experiences, is expanding its operations due to unprecedented growth. We are currently seeking highly motivated and proficient individuals to join our esteemed team across various departments. This presents a unique opportunity for career development within a world-class hospitality environment.

We are particularly interested in candidates who demonstrate a strong commitment to excellence and are prepared for potential relocation to London to contribute to our dynamic operations. Comprehensive onboarding and continuous professional development opportunities will be provided to all successful candidates.

**Featured Opening: Information Management Specialist**

This pivotal role is central to maintaining the accuracy and efficiency of our critical data systems. The Information Management Specialist will be responsible for overseeing data integrity, managing digital records, and providing essential analytical support to various departmental operations.

**Key Responsibilities:**
*   Efficiently manage and update extensive databases, ensuring accuracy and compliance.
*   Process and analyze information to support operational decision-making and reporting.
*   Maintain the confidentiality and security of sensitive guest and operational data.
*   Collaborate with departmental heads to optimize information flow and system utilization.
*   Contribute to the continuous improvement of our digital infrastructure and data management protocols.

**Qualifications:**
*   Proven experience in data management, information processing, or a related administrative role, preferably within a corporate or luxury service environment.
*   Proficiency with various office software suites and database management systems.
*   Exceptional attention to detail and strong organizational capabilities.
*   Ability to work autonomously and as part of a collaborative team.
*   Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

**Compensation & Benefits:**
Full-time positions offer a competitive basic monthly remuneration ranging from **£2,500 GBP to £3,500 GBP**, commensurate with experience and the specific role offered. Our comprehensive benefits package includes attractive allowances, dedicated professional development programs, and extensive relocation support for eligible international candidates, encompassing necessary travel and documentation assistance. Full details regarding our attractive remuneration structure and accommodation arrangements will be discussed with shortlisted applicants.

**Diverse Opportunities:**
Beyond the featured role, we are actively recruiting across a wide spectrum of hotel operations, including senior management, culinary arts, guest services, finance, maintenance, and security. We encourage seasoned professionals across all disciplines to explore potential alignment with our luxury brand.

**Application Process:**
Interested and qualified candidates are invited to submit their comprehensive CV/Resume via email to: #EMAIL_190796bc17c2a4aa3da467f4f7997179a9fc0eae9d2c48712e7fa8a316d8609f#

We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to the Montcalm Luxury Hotel London team.

Sincerely,

Ashwini Lakshman
Human Resources Department
Montcalm Luxury Hotel London

title: HSE Manager
description: Corporate overviewAker Solutions is a global provider of products, systems and services to the oil and gas industry. Our engineering, design and technology bring discoveries into production and maximize recovery from each petroleum field. We employ approximately 28,000 people in about 30 countries. Go to #URL_0fa3f7c5e23a16de16a841e368006cae916884407d90b154dfef3976483a71ae# for more information on our business, people and values.We are looking for individuals who are prepared to take a position. Not only a position within Aker Solutions, but also a position on the exciting challenges the global oil and gas industry faces now and in the futureAker Solutions is a leading global oil services company that provides engineering and construction services, technology, products and field-life solutions for the oil & gas industry. Aker Solutions currently has 28 000 people working worldwide.Our Business very much depends on our people; all our major achievements are team efforts. We are looking for dedicated team players who like to be part of a winning team, who meet challenges head on to serve our customers’ needs.MMO based in Aberdeen, have excellent opportunities for talented individuals who can strengthen our team and support our ambitious growth plans within the engineering, construction, maintenance, modification and operations market.We are currently looking for a HSE Manager.Responsibilities and tasks Promote the HSE Mindset throughout the organisation in a motivating and inspiring manner.To provide HS&E support and professional advice to the Company, Clients and Vendors as appropriate, both on and offshore.Responsible for liaising with Project Managers on a day-to-day basis to ensure that all aspects of HS&E are being adequately supported.Input to project Safety Case. Develop and facilitate new innovative approaches to further improve HSE attitudes and performance. Ensure compliance with corporate HS&E Policies. Act as Company Representative for both internal and external customers on all HSE related activities. Advise and support senior management team on HSE policy issues, objectives, planning and implementation. This includes the establishment of annual HSE objectives and targets for the organisation. Ensure continuous improvement in the Company HSE performance and visibility. This will include the establishment and implementation of improvement plans and appropriate performance measurement systems. Play an active role in Aker Solutions corporate HSE initiatives and networks. Liaise with Regulatory and other external agencies and industry representative bodies. Establish and maintain a best in class documented corporate management system. This includes: Full understanding and implementation within the company. Establishment of an effective mechanism to ensure the continuous improvement of the system and management of corrective & preventive actions. Development and implementation of annual audit schedules. Establish, maintain and co-ordinate all HSE related activities in support of Aker Solutions contracts and projects, including the allocation of appropriate HSE resources. Responsibility for the input of HSE related information to pre-qualifications, tenders etc. Actively participate in industry HS&E forums to increase the company’s profile in this area and ensure that current information is disseminated throughout the organisation. Maintain certification to all of the appropriate recognised standards, including ISO 14001 & ISO 18001.  Advise on the development and maintenance of the H,S & E elements of the management system. To participate and support the tender submission processes. To maintain close working relationship with Management teams and the workforce both on and offshore. Undertake regular site visits, on and offshore and provide additional HS&E cover if required. To support the statistics gathering, analysis and reporting process.  Developing Safety Alerts, bulletins and any other forms of promotion of lateral learning within the Company and the Industry. Develop, support and regularly review HS&E improvement plans for Corporate and Projects. Development of procedures, training packages and audit schedules. Conducting audits and reviews. Co-ordinate and undertake Task Risk Assessments in all aspects of legislative requirements. Monitor legislative change and advise on impact to Company. Supporting management in ensuring that a strong HS&E culture is maintained within their areas of responsibility. Act as Behavioural Safety Focal Point and WorkSafe Champion. The day-to-day implementation and monitoring of HSE procedures and safe systems of work. Maintaining risks to personnel, plant and equipment and operations as low as reasonably practicable by ensuring that personnel are trained and competent to undertake tasks assigned to them. Ensuring timely reporting of incidents and quality assurance of input into Synergi. Participation/ facilitation of investigation of any accidents, incidents, dangerous occurrences or near-misses involving MMO US employees or sub-contractors. To provide Corporate and Project support to MMO US. To carry out emergency response duties as required. To liaise with regulatory authorities. Implement office safety initiatives and inductions.
benefits: We offer• Friendly colleagues in an industry with a bright future.• An environment where you are encouraged to develop your skills and share your knowledge with your colleagues.• Competitive benefits and strong focus on work-life balance.
refined_description:
**HSE Manager**

**About Aker Solutions**
Aker Solutions stands as a preeminent global leader in the energy sector, delivering advanced solutions and cutting-edge technologies that drive sustainable development and operational excellence worldwide. With a formidable presence across approximately 30 countries and a diverse team of 28,000 dedicated professionals, we are at the forefront of shaping the future of energy production and resource optimization. Our commitment extends beyond conventional practices, embracing innovation and a forward-thinking approach to address the complex challenges facing the global energy landscape.

**The Opportunity**
We are actively seeking a highly strategic and results-oriented **HSE Manager** to join our distinguished team in Aberdeen. This pivotal role offers a unique opportunity to not only contribute to our ambitious growth trajectory but also to champion a culture of unparalleled safety and environmental stewardship across our global operations. We seek an individual prepared to lead, innovate, and make a tangible impact on critical strategic initiatives, ensuring our continued leadership in operational integrity within the dynamic engineering, construction, maintenance, modification, and operations market.

**Key Responsibilities**

*   Spearhead the development, implementation, and continuous enhancement of enterprise-wide Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) strategies and initiatives. Provide expert counsel and leadership to senior management and project teams, fostering a proactive HSE culture that transcends operational boundaries.
*   Drive the integration of best-in-class safety paradigms into all facets of our global operations, ensuring adherence to the highest international standards and regulatory frameworks. Champion innovative approaches to HSE performance improvement and cultivate strong relationships with regulatory bodies and industry forums to maintain Aker Solutions' position as an industry leader.
*   Architect, maintain, and continually refine our robust corporate HSE management system, ensuring its alignment with evolving legislative requirements and global certification standards, including ISO 14001 and ISO 18001. Oversee the development and execution of comprehensive audit schedules, identifying areas for optimization and implementing impactful corrective and preventive actions.
*   Strategically manage and coordinate all HSE-related activities across diverse contracts and projects, optimizing resource allocation to achieve exemplary safety performance. Provide critical HSE input for pre-qualification, tender, and contract negotiation phases, safeguarding our operational integrity and competitive advantage.
*   Drive the operationalization of HSE policies, including the development of advanced procedures, training modules, and risk assessment methodologies. Oversee incident investigation, root cause analysis, and the implementation of effective corrective measures to minimize operational risks.
*   Act as a key liaison with all levels of the organization, fostering a strong behavioral safety culture through direct engagement, mentorship, and the deployment of innovative safety programs. Provide essential on-site and remote support, including emergency response coordination, ensuring a consistently safe working environment across all facilities and projects.

**Qualifications**

*   Proven track record of success in a senior HSE leadership role within a complex industrial or global energy environment, preferably within oil & gas or similar heavy industry.
*   Exceptional strategic foresight with the ability to translate complex regulatory requirements into actionable organizational policies and programs.
*   Demonstrated expertise in developing, implementing, and managing certified HSE management systems (e.g., ISO 14001, ISO 18001).
*   Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
*   Outstanding communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, capable of influencing stakeholders at all levels, internally and externally.
*   Relevant professional certifications and advanced qualifications in Occupational Health, Safety, and Environmental management.

**What We Offer**

*   An unparalleled opportunity to define and lead the HSE vision for a global industry leader, impacting operations across 30+ countries.
*   A highly competitive remuneration package, commensurate with your expertise and the strategic importance of this role.
*   A dynamic, challenging, and collaborative work environment that values innovation, integrity, and sustainable growth.
*   Significant scope for professional development and career progression within a forward-thinking organization at the forefront of the energy transition.
*   The chance to be part of a team that genuinely impacts the safety and well-being of thousands globally.

**Application Process**
Interested candidates are invited to submit a comprehensive CV and cover letter outlining their suitability for this executive role.

refined_description:
**Job Title:** Precision Systems Integration Specialist – Energy Sector

**Company Overview:**
As a leading global innovator in advanced energy solutions, our organization stands at the forefront of engineering, design, and technological advancement within the dynamic oil and gas industry. With an expansive global footprint and a diverse talent pool across numerous countries, we are committed to transforming discoveries into sustainable production and maximizing resource recovery. We invite exceptional professionals to join our team, contributing to the critical global energy challenges of today and shaping the future of industrial innovation. Our North American operations, spanning key hubs in Houston, Mobile, Bakersfield, Calgary, and St. Johns, are expanding, and we are actively seeking talented individuals poised to strengthen our capabilities and support our ambitious strategic growth initiatives.

**Opportunity Summary:**
We are seeking a highly skilled and meticulous Precision Systems Integration Specialist to join our elite technical operations team. This pivotal role involves the expert assembly, rigorous testing, and precise integration of complex mechanical systems, ensuring the highest standards of operational excellence and product integrity. The ideal candidate will thrive in a dynamic, collaborative, and forward-thinking environment, demonstrating exceptional technical acumen and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

**Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:**

refined_description:
**Senior Package Engineering & Procurement Specialist**

**Company Overview:**
Aker Solutions stands as a preeminent global leader in delivering innovative products, systems, and services to the dynamic oil and gas industry. Our foundational commitment to pioneering engineering, transformative design, and advanced technology empowers us to translate groundbreaking discoveries into sustainable production, maximizing resource recovery across diverse petroleum fields worldwide. With a formidable global presence spanning approximately 30 countries and a dedicated workforce exceeding 28,000 professionals, Aker Solutions is synonymous with industry leadership and forward-thinking solutions.

At Aker Engineering & Technology, our Houston hub spearheads cutting-edge front-end studies, comprehensive engineering, strategic procurement, and meticulous project management services crucial for initiating and executing high-value contracts within the onshore and offshore oil & gas sectors. We are not merely participants; we are significant contributors to the evolution of new technologies, proprietary products, advanced methodologies, and specialized knowledge that drive unparalleled efficiency, cost optimization, and environmental stewardship in global energy exploitation.

We are actively seeking visionary individuals prepared to seize a pivotal role – not only within our esteemed organization but also in confronting the intricate, exciting challenges that define the global energy landscape today and tomorrow. This is an unparalleled opportunity to contribute meaningfully to a future shaped by innovation and sustainable impact.

**Key Responsibilities:**
The Senior Package Engineering & Procurement Specialist will be entrusted with pivotal responsibilities critical to the successful delivery of complex projects, with a primary focus on specialized package equipment. This multifaceted role demands a strategic mindset and meticulous execution, encompassing:

*   **Strategic Equipment Analysis:** Conduct comprehensive assessments to identify optimal equipment types aligned with stringent service and operational duty requirements.
*   **Technical Optimization & Integration:** Spearhead detailed equipment sizing, evaluate footprint and weight implications, and provide critical input for integrated layout, electrical load, and sophisticated cost/weight estimations.
*   **Solution Justification & Documentation:** Champion and formally document equipment selection through robust, data-driven study reports, ensuring alignment with project objectives.
*   **Cross-Functional Synergy:** Foster exemplary collaboration with Process, Layout, and other core disciplines to engineer and implement resilient, integrated technical solutions.
*   **Supplier Relationship Management:** Cultivate and maintain strategic relationships with key equipment suppliers, ensuring seamless technical alignment and optimal selection outcomes.
*   **Interface Management Excellence:** Proactively manage complex design interfaces pertaining to package equipment, mitigating risks and ensuring seamless system integration.
*   **Comprehensive Documentation & Tendering:** Develop and refine comprehensive Technical Requisitions & Specifications for budgeting, inquiry, and final purchase order documentation, reflecting best-in-class industry standards.
*   **Pre-Order Activity Leadership:** Oversee and execute all technical activities preceding order placement, ensuring meticulous preparation and adherence to project timelines.
*   **Advanced Bid Evaluation:** Conduct rigorous evaluations of supplier bids and technical solutions for package equipment, advising on selections that yield maximum value and strategic advantage.

**Lead Structural Engineer**

**About Aker Solutions:**
Aker Solutions stands at the forefront of pioneering solutions for the global energy sector, transforming challenges into opportunities and maximizing resource recovery worldwide. With a vast global footprint and a commitment to innovation, we cultivate an environment where groundbreaking ideas flourish and ambitious careers thrive. We are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of engineering excellence and making a tangible impact on the future of energy. Explore our presence, people, and values at our corporate portal.

We seek a visionary engineer with a proven track record in complex structural analysis, an unwavering commitment to safety, and a passion for innovation within the energy industry.

**Senior Back-End Mobile Engineer (Ruby)**

At the vanguard of agricultural innovation, our organization is pioneering a new era of data-driven insights to empower farmers globally. Leveraging an unparalleled volume of meteorological, hydrological, and soil science data – exceeding 200 terabytes and encompassing trillions of simulation data points – we operate one of the most sophisticated AWS-powered platforms in the industry. Our proprietary technology platform is redefining agricultural risk management and farm productivity, delivering transformative solutions in the face of escalating global climate challenges. We are not just building software; we are cultivating a sustainable future, driven by a profound commitment to innovation and tangible real-world impact. We seek visionary professionals eager to tackle complex challenges and contribute to a legacy of global change.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Back-End Mobile Engineer with deep expertise in Ruby to join our elite engineering team. This pivotal role will be instrumental in architecting and evolving the core infrastructure supporting our next-generation mobile applications, delivering critical insights directly into the hands of agricultural stakeholders worldwide.

**What You Will Do:**

*   Design, develop, and deploy highly scalable, fault-tolerant RESTful APIs and microservices that power our suite of mobile applications, ensuring unparalleled performance and reliability.
*   Collaborate synergistically with cross-functional teams, including mobile, data science, and product, to translate complex requirements into elegant, high-impact technical solutions.
*   Champion best practices in code quality, security, and architectural integrity, influencing the technical direction of critical platform components.
*   Proactively explore and integrate emerging technologies and frameworks, continually enhancing our technological capabilities and maintaining our competitive edge.
*   Participate in the full software development lifecycle, from conceptualization and design to testing, deployment, and ongoing optimization.

**Qualifications:**

*   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
*   Extensive experience (5+ years) in back-end development with a strong focus on Ruby and Ruby on Rails.
*   Proven track record of designing and implementing highly scalable, distributed systems.
*   Proficiency with cloud platforms, particularly Amazon Web Services (AWS).
*   Solid understanding of database technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, NoSQL solutions) and query optimization.
*   Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a strong grasp of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles.
*   Excellent communication and collaboration skills within a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

*   Master's degree in a relevant technical discipline.
*   Experience with mobile API design and integration patterns.
*   Familiarity with geospatial data processing or agricultural technology domains.

**What We Offer:**

*   A competitive compensation package commensurate with experience.
*   Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.
*   Generous paid time off and flexible work arrangements.
*   Unparalleled opportunities for rapid professional growth and significant impact within a cutting-edge, mission-driven organization.
*   A vibrant, collaborative culture dedicated to solving some of the world's most pressing challenges.

**To Apply:**

If you are a driven professional passionate about leveraging technology to create meaningful global impact, we encourage you to submit your resume and a compelling cover letter detailing your relevant experience and aspirations.

**Structural Divisional Manager**

**Company Overview:**
Aker Solutions stands as a globally recognized leader in delivering integrated products, systems, and services for the energy sector. We are at the forefront of transforming complex engineering challenges into sustainable solutions, driving innovation, and maximizing value across the entire asset lifecycle. Our expansive global presence across numerous countries is powered by a diverse and highly skilled workforce committed to pioneering advancements and shaping the future of industrial development. We are actively seeking visionary leaders prepared to embrace significant challenges and contribute to our ongoing success.

**Position Summary:**
Based in our vibrant Houston, Texas hub, the Structural Divisional Manager within our Engineering & Technology division will assume a pivotal leadership role. This position demands a seasoned professional capable of providing strategic oversight, expert guidance, and inspiring leadership to our team of accomplished structural engineers and designers. You will be instrumental in ensuring technical excellence, operational efficiency, and the successful delivery of our most complex projects.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Provide astute strategic leadership and comprehensive technical direction for all structural engineering aspects of project execution within the division.
*   Champion a culture of innovation, excellence, and continuous professional development among engineering and design teams.
*   Orchestrate robust fiscal planning, resource allocation, and budget management to optimize departmental performance.
*   Conduct rigorous technical peer reviews, ensuring adherence to the highest standards of quality, safety, and regulatory compliance.
*   Lead talent acquisition initiatives, strategically build and cultivate a high-performing structural engineering team, and conduct comprehensive performance evaluations.
*   Architect and refine foundational corporate processes, procedures, and best practices for the structural discipline, ensuring seamless operational flow.
*   Generate meticulous project proposals, detailed man-hour estimations, and contractual agreements, influencing strategic bids and client engagements.
*   Cultivate influential relationships with key stakeholders, clients, and partners across Aker Solutions’ global operations.
*   Serve as a thought leader, staying abreast of pioneering industry advancements, national and international standards, and evolving legislative requirements within the structural engineering domain.

**Qualifications:**
Candidates should possess a proven track record of leadership in large-scale engineering environments, coupled with exceptional technical acumen and a profound understanding of structural design principles and project management methodologies. Demonstrated ability to lead multidisciplinary teams, manage complex budgets, and drive strategic initiatives is essential.

**Principal Subsea Process Systems Engineer**

**Location:** Houston, TX

Aker Solutions is a global leader pioneering the future of energy infrastructure through transformative subsea technologies and integrated field solutions. With an unwavering commitment to innovation and sustainable practices, we are strategically evolving to meet the complex demands of the global energy landscape. As we embark on a new chapter, forming distinct entities to maximize our strategic focus and market leadership, we invite exceptional talent to join our elite team. This is a unique opportunity to shape the core of our subsea processing capabilities and contribute to projects that redefine industry benchmarks.

We are seeking visionary and highly motivated engineers to assume a pivotal role within our subsea power and process unit in Houston. You will be instrumental in architecting and delivering advanced subsea processing solutions, driving the realization of the next-generation "subsea factory" concept.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic Leadership:** Spearhead the conceptualization, development, and market integration of groundbreaking subsea processing technologies and systems, from initial ideation to commercial deployment.
*   **Technical Authority:** Serve as the lead process system specialist, providing unparalleled technical leadership across complex subsea processing projects, critical studies, and innovative concept developments.
*   **System Architecture:** Design, optimize, and simulate sophisticated process system layouts, ensuring peak performance, reliability, and scalability for diverse subsea applications including separation, compression, and power systems.
*   **Technology Integration:** Be accountable for the comprehensive definition and strategic selection of cutting-edge process system equipment, driving excellence in component integration and system efficacy.
*   **Innovation & Excellence:** Champion continuous improvement initiatives, fostering a culture of innovation and technical mastery within the team to address the most challenging industry frontiers.

**Qualifications:**

*   A strong academic background in a relevant engineering discipline.
*   Demonstrated expertise and a proven track record in subsea processing technologies, ideally encompassing separation, compression, and power systems.
*   Exceptional analytical acumen, problem-solving capabilities, and a proactive, results-oriented mindset.
*   Superior communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to influence and lead cross-functional initiatives.

**We Offer:**

An empowering and dynamic environment where your contributions directly impact global energy solutions. This role provides an unparalleled trajectory for professional growth, competitive remuneration, and the opportunity to collaborate with industry pioneers on projects of global significance.

**Application Process:**

Qualified candidates are invited to submit their comprehensive CV/Resume and a compelling cover letter detailing their relevant experience and alignment with our vision. Applications will be reviewed with discretion, and selected candidates will be contacted for further engagement.

Aker Solutions is a global industry leader, at the forefront of delivering innovative products, systems, and services that drive the global oil and gas sector forward. With a deep commitment to maximizing resource recovery and pioneering sustainable energy solutions, our diverse team of 28,000 professionals spans over 30 countries. We are dedicated to navigating the dynamic landscape of the global energy industry and are seeking visionary talent eager to make a significant impact.

We are currently seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented **Management Systems Administrator** to join our Quality Management group in Houston, TX. You will be instrumental in strengthening our operational infrastructure and facilitating our strategic growth within the offshore energy market.

*   Actively contribute to high-profile engineering improvement initiatives, with ample opportunities for skill development and career advancement within our dynamic HSEQ domain.

*   Proven experience in managing and optimizing complex information systems, particularly SharePoint environments.
