title: Project Subcontracting Manager
description: Corporate overviewAker Solutions is a global provider of products, systems and services to the oil and gas industry. Our engineering, design and technology bring discoveries into production and maximize recovery from each petroleum field. We employ approximately 28,000 people in about 30 countries. Go to #URL_0fa3f7c5e23a16de16a841e368006cae916884407d90b154dfef3976483a71ae# for more information on our business, people and values.We are looking for individuals who are prepared to take a position. Not only a position within Aker Solutions, but also a position on the exciting challenges the global oil and gas industry faces now and in the futureAker Solutions are looking to recruit a Project Subcontracting Manager to be based in their Houston office, USA.We are currently expanding and we need new talents who can strengthen our team and support our ambitious plans within the subsea market.Responsibilities and tasks- Overall responsibility for management of the Joint Venture (JV) its contracts ie. management of subcontracts and own fabrication and test activities at service base in the country/region of execution. - Promote HSE and quality mindset, on-time delivery, co-operation, proactive- and resolution oriented mindset and continuous improvement. - To participate in the project from System Definition phase and heavily engaged during Detailing & Fabrication, Assembly and Integration test phases. - Is part of the Project Management Team and is jointly accountable for achieving the project objectives (budget, scope, time schedule and quality).Execution overall - Managing all resources being part of the JV as well as all subcontracting/site teams- Participate on Tender teams when bidding on new SPS / MSP projects - Review ITT and determine client requirements for Local content and hence subcontracting- Establish project specific Terms & Conditions for Purchase Orders to subcontractors when required, including LCI requirements- Prepare and negotiate any MOU and contracts with potential partners/subcontractors/local suppliers as part of BD/tendering activities and as part of project execution- Reviewing and analysing subcontractors/local supplier quotations as required- Managing the contracts towards local suppliers/subcontractors wrt scope, time, cost and qualityExecution at site(s);- Ensure timely delivery from product areas deliveries, including engineering documents and HW for local content execution- Ensure timely handling of any deviations- Is authorized to take and implement necessary decisions to ensure efficient performance construction and testing - Ensure mechanical completion on site- Ensure development of final documentation- Coordinate on site to facilitate for system integration testing (SIT)- Ensure required tooling is available for testing - Ensure SLS (local service base) participation in the project from System Definition phase including a proper handover- Ensure proper tidying up and handling of the test EQ, remained stock at site at the end of the project Scope Management- Report to the Project Management Core Team on any contractual or commercial issues related to sub-contractors- Prepare a list of necessary commercial and contractual qualifications for inclusion in tenders/projects for subcontract amendments or variation- Ensure that the fabrication is in accordance with the design- Assist in claims management and claims resolutionTime Management- Coordinate supplies to site (CPI/free issued items), fabrication and testing activities- Overlook fabrication, manufacturing and testing activities to ensure timely deliveriesQuality Management- Review quality plans for internal and subcontracted fabrication and follow up fabrication sites for proper implementation Communication Management- Ensure efficient communication between the project and manufacturing sites- Report progress on construction, fabrication and testing activitiesHSE Management- Provide feedback and supervise HSE plans since early in the project- Coordinate and monitor HSE requirements during construction and testing to ensure top HSE standards- Ensure on site HSE activities/actions (participate and document SJA, regular and ad-hoc inspections, train SIT team, handle SIT "visitors", get photo permissions for SIT resources etc)
benefits: We offer• Friendly colleagues in an industry with a bright future.• An environment where you are encouraged to develop your skills and share your knowledge with your colleagues.• Competitive benefits and strong focus on work-life balance.
refined_description:
Aker Solutions is a globally recognized leader and innovator within the energy sector, dedicated to pioneering advanced solutions that empower the responsible development and optimization of oil and gas resources worldwide. With a profound commitment to engineering excellence, cutting-edge design, and transformative technology, we are at the forefront of translating groundbreaking discoveries into sustained production and maximizing asset recovery. Our extensive global footprint, spanning approximately 30 countries and a diverse workforce of 28,000 professionals, underscores our unwavering dedication to global energy progress. Discover more about our pioneering vision, our exceptional people, and our core values at #URL_0fa3f7c5e23a16de16a841e368006cae916884407d90b154dfef3976483a71ae#.

We are currently navigating a period of unprecedented expansion, particularly within the dynamic subsea market. To champion our ambitious strategic initiatives and fortify our market leadership, Aker Solutions is actively seeking a visionary and results-oriented Project Subcontracting Manager to join our esteemed team in Houston, USA. This pivotal role is crafted for an individual poised not only to excel within our organization but also to significantly contribute to the complex and exhilarating challenges facing the global energy industry, shaping its future trajectory.

**Core Responsibilities & Strategic Contributions:**

*   **Strategic Leadership & Partnership Management:** Provide holistic oversight and strategic direction for the management of joint ventures (JVs) and all associated contractual frameworks. This includes comprehensive management of sophisticated subcontracting agreements and proprietary fabrication and testing operations within the designated operational region.
*   **Operational Excellence & Performance Assurance:** Champion an uncompromising culture of Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) stewardship and unparalleled quality. Drive initiatives that ensure exemplary on-time delivery, foster collaborative synergies, cultivate a proactive, solution-driven mindset, and embed continuous improvement methodologies across all facets of project execution.
*   **Integrated Project Lifecycle Engagement:** Influence and integrate deeply across the entire project lifecycle, from the conceptual System Definition phase through critical Detailing & Fabrication, Assembly, and rigorous Integration Test phases.
*   **Executive Team Collaboration & Accountability:** Serve as an integral and highly influential member of the Project Management Team, sharing direct accountability for the successful attainment of all project objectives, encompassing budget adherence, scope integrity, schedule precision, and quality benchmarks.
*   **Resource Optimization & Tender Strategy:** Provide astute leadership for all resources deployed within the JV and affiliated subcontracting/site teams. Strategically participate in high-stakes tender teams, shaping competitive bids for new Subsea Production System (SPS) and Multi-Stage Project (MSP) engagements.
*   **Contractual Architecture & Negotiation:** Conduct meticulous review of Invitation to Tender (ITT) documentation, discerning critical client requirements for Local Content and subsequently devising bespoke subcontracting strategies. Formulate and negotiate project-specific Terms & Conditions for high-value Purchase Orders to subcontractors, meticulously incorporating Local Content Initiative (LCI) prerequisites. Expertly prepare and negotiate intricate Memoranda of Understanding (MOUs) and comprehensive contracts with prospective partners and strategic subcontractors, both during business development/tendering phases and throughout project execution.
*   **Fiscal Prudence & Supplier Relationship Management:** Conduct astute evaluations of strategic partner and local supplier quotations. Cultivate and manage robust contractual relationships, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives for scope, schedule, fiscal integrity, and quality assurance.
*   **Site Operations & Readiness:** Ensure the seamless, timely delivery of product area components, including critical engineering documentation and hardware, vital for local content execution. Proactively mitigate and resolve complex operational deviations, exercising the autonomy to implement decisive actions for peak construction and testing performance. Ensure flawless mechanical completion on site and meticulous development of final documentation. Orchestrate on-site coordination to facilitate seamless system integration testing (SIT), ensuring requisite tooling is consistently available. Guarantee robust local service base (SLS) participation from the System Definition phase, facilitating impeccable handover protocols and meticulous post-project site demobilization.
*   **Holistic Scope & Claims Management:** Report comprehensively to the Project Management Core Team on all significant contractual and commercial matters pertaining to subcontractors. Develop robust commercial and contractual qualifications for inclusion in tenders/projects for subcontract amendments or variations. Verify fabrication integrity in strict accordance with design specifications. Provide strategic support in complex claims management and resolution processes.
*   **Advanced Scheduling & Oversight:** Coordinate the intricate logistics of supplies to site (CPI/free issued items), fabrication, and testing activities. Provide sophisticated oversight of fabrication, manufacturing, and testing operations to ensure precise, timely deliveries.
*   **Quality Assurance Leadership:** Review and validate comprehensive quality plans for both internal and subcontracted fabrication, conducting rigorous follow-ups at fabrication sites to ensure impeccable implementation.
*   **Cross-Functional Communication & Reporting:** Foster exceptionally efficient communication channels between project teams and manufacturing sites. Deliver precise, high-level progress reports on construction, fabrication, and testing endeavors.
*   **Exemplary HSE Stewardship:** Provide critical feedback and expert supervision of HSE plans from the nascent project stages. Coordinate and vigilantly monitor HSE requirements during construction and testing to uphold the industry's most stringent standards. Drive proactive on-site HSE initiatives, including active participation in and documentation of Safety Job Analyses (SJAs), conducting regular and ad-hoc inspections, comprehensive training for the SIT team, managing SIT visitor protocols, and securing necessary photo permissions.

**Candidate Profile:**
We are seeking an individual who not only possesses a sterling track record in project management and subcontracting but also demonstrates exceptional acumen in navigating complex global supply chains and fostering high-performance teams. The ideal candidate will be a visionary leader, capable of influencing outcomes at an executive level, thriving in a high-octane environment, and consistently exceeding expectations. While specific industry experience is beneficial, we prioritize individuals with a demonstrable history of strategic thinking, impeccable negotiation skills, and a commitment to continuous professional elevation.

**Why Join Aker Solutions?**
At Aker Solutions, we don't just offer jobs; we provide transformative career trajectories. You will be immersed in an environment where innovation is celebrated, strategic contributions are highly valued, and your professional growth is actively nurtured. We offer an unparalleled opportunity to work on paradigm-shifting projects that define the future of global energy, supported by a highly competitive compensation package, robust benefits, and a culture of excellence and mutual respect. This is your chance to make a profound impact and shape the industry's future.

**Financial Operations Associate, Accounts Receivable**

Our organization is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Financial Operations Associate to join our dynamic finance team. This pivotal role is central to maintaining the fiscal health and operational efficiency of the company through expert management of our accounts receivable and credit functions. The successful candidate will contribute significantly to optimizing cash flow and providing critical financial insights to leadership.

**Key Responsibilities:**

title: Production Engineer
description: Corporate overviewAker Solutions is a global provider of products, systems and services to the oil and gas industry. Our engineering, design and technology bring discoveries into production and maximize recovery from each petroleum field. We employ approximately 28,000 people in about 30 countries. Go to #URL_0fa3f7c5e23a16de16a841e368006cae916884407d90b154dfef3976483a71ae# for more information on our business, people and values.We are looking for individuals who are prepared to take a position. Not only a position within Aker Solutions, but also a position on the exciting challenges the global oil and gas industry faces now and in the futureAker Solutions' Assembly and Test Engineering Team based in Houston is responsible for first level Engineering Support for our complex Subsea Control modules and peripheral equipment. As part of that support, the team are heavily involved in Cap Ex projects to enhance and improve our working practices and procedures within Manufacturing. We need an experienced Produduction Engineer with a multidisciplined background, andt someone who has a good understanding of process improvement, FMEA and Capital Expenditure Project delivery. This is a key role for this business area as we looked to develop the overall team in driving improvement to increase, yield, productivity and on-time delivery of our products.Responsibilities and tasks:• To map, perform gap analysis, and propose and implement improvements to existing manufacturing practices, processes, tooling and equipment, thereby improving quality and reducing lead times.• To perform scope feasibility, define specification, raise CapEx and project manage new production equipment and tooling. • To liaise with third party vendors on the specification, design and build of new tooling and equipment, and the modification of existing.• To create and/or support the creation of manufacturing process and equipment work/operating instructions. • To support the maintenance department in defining maintenance requirements for both new and existing tooling and equipment.• To provide support to other Aker company sites with regards to cross-site tooling and equipment, and process standardisation.• To work closely with all other engineering support departments on all areas of electro-mechanical / hydraulic engineering from initial concepts through to final build.• To support both Operations and Engineering in the issuing of method improvement statements.• To actively participate in all continuous improvement activities that support improvement in production and product build areas.• To support audit processes both internally and externally at vendors, customers or third party companies.

refined_description:
**Strategic Operations Engineer, Manufacturing Excellence**

**Corporate Overview**

Aker Solutions is a pioneering global leader at the forefront of energy industry innovation, dedicated to shaping a sustainable future through advanced products, systems, and services. Our world-class engineering, groundbreaking design, and proprietary technologies are instrumental in transforming discoveries into productive assets and maximizing value across petroleum fields globally. We cultivate a dynamic, collaborative ecosystem, comprising an elite cohort of professionals spanning over 30 countries, united by a shared vision of excellence. We invite highly motivated individuals to join our mission, not merely to fill a position, but to contribute substantively to the strategic evolution and exciting challenges facing the global energy landscape.

**Role Summary**

Based within our distinguished Assembly and Test Engineering Team in Houston, this pivotal role as Strategic Operations Engineer, Manufacturing Excellence, is central to providing advanced-tier engineering support for our sophisticated Subsea Control modules and associated high-integrity equipment. This position will be instrumental in spearheading high-impact Capital Expenditure (CapEx) programs and driving transformative initiatives aimed at elevating our operational paradigms, enhancing efficiency, and optimizing manufacturing workflows. This is a critical leadership-aligned role designed for an experienced professional with a multidisciplinary engineering background, poised to profoundly influence our pursuit of enhanced yield, heightened productivity, and unparalleled on-time delivery across our product portfolio.

**Core Responsibilities & Strategic Contributions**

*   Spearhead the strategic analysis, holistic optimization, and transformative implementation of advanced manufacturing methodologies, processes, tooling, and equipment to elevate quality benchmarks and compress critical lead times.
*   Drive end-to-end Capital Expenditure program management, encompassing comprehensive feasibility assessments, precise technical specification development, financial allocation oversight, and meticulous project execution for pioneering production assets and tooling.
*   Cultivate strategic partnerships with elite third-party vendors, overseeing the entire lifecycle of bespoke tooling and equipment — from conceptual design and rigorous specification to precision fabrication and seamless integration or enhancement of existing infrastructure.
*   Lead the development and refinement of authoritative manufacturing process documentation and operational protocols, ensuring unparalleled clarity and adherence to global best practices.
*   Collaborate closely with asset management teams to architect robust maintenance strategies and lifecycle support frameworks for both emergent and established technological assets.
*   Champion cross-functional and inter-site operational alignment, driving the adoption of standardized processes, tooling, and equipment paradigms across our international footprint.
*   Foster highly synergistic collaborations with multidisciplinary engineering cohorts, guiding electro-mechanical and hydraulic solutions from nascent ideation through to final, high-performance deployment.
*   Act as a pivotal consultant to both Operations and Engineering leadership, formulating and championing high-impact methodological advancements and continuous improvement initiatives.
*   Serve as a proactive architect of continuous improvement frameworks, profoundly impacting production efficiency and product realization cycles.
*   Oversee and facilitate comprehensive quality assurance and compliance auditing processes, both internally and across our esteemed network of vendors, clients, and strategic partners.

**Qualifications**

*   Demonstrated mastery in Production Engineering or a cognate engineering discipline, underpinned by a robust multidisciplinary technical foundation.
*   Profound expertise in advanced process optimization methodologies, including FMEA, Lean Manufacturing, and Six Sigma principles.
*   Proven track record in orchestrating and delivering complex Capital Expenditure projects with a focus on innovation and efficiency.
*   Exceptional analytical acumen and strategic problem-solving capabilities, with a meticulous attention to detail.
*   Superior communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, capable of influencing stakeholders at all organizational tiers and fostering productive external partnerships.
*   A visionary approach to manufacturing challenges, coupled with a pragmatic commitment to actionable solutions and measurable results.

**What We Offer**

Join a forward-thinking global enterprise where your expertise will directly contribute to groundbreaking projects and strategic initiatives. We offer a highly competitive remuneration package, comprehensive benefits, and unparalleled opportunities for professional development and career trajectory within a dynamic, high-performance environment.

**Application Process**

Qualified candidates are invited to submit a comprehensive CV and a compelling cover letter outlining their strategic contributions and alignment with this role's objectives via our dedicated online recruitment portal.

**Senior Backend Mobile Developer (Ruby)**

**About Us:**
At the nexus of environmental science and cutting-edge technology, we are redefining agricultural resilience for a rapidly changing world. As one of the preeminent users of Amazon Web Services, our robust technology platform meticulously processes an unparalleled volume of environmental data – including over 34 trillion weather simulation data points, 150 billion soil type observations, and more than 3 million daily real-time weather measurements. We are not merely processing data; we are architecting the future of global food security, committed to delivering profound, tangible real-world impact and fearlessly tackling challenges others deem insurmountable. Our ambition is woven into our DNA: to leave an indelible mark on the world by finding the possible in the impossible.

**The Opportunity:**
We are seeking an exceptionally talented and visionary **Senior Backend Mobile Developer** with deep Ruby expertise to join our elite engineering team. This pivotal role involves shaping the core infrastructure that powers our revolutionary mobile applications, directly empowering growers to optimize their operations and mitigate risks in the face of increasingly extreme weather patterns. This is a unique chance to contribute to a mission-driven organization where your ingenuity will directly impact global sustainability and economic stability.

**Key Responsibilities:**
*   Architect, develop, and deploy highly scalable, resilient, and performant RESTful APIs that serve as the backbone for our cutting-edge mobile applications, empowering a global user base.
*   Collaborate intrinsically with our dynamic iOS and Android development teams, ensuring seamless, robust, and optimized data flow and system integration from backend to user interface.
*   Drive innovation by actively evaluating, proposing, and implementing emerging technologies and architectural patterns to continuously elevate our platform's capabilities and future-proof our solutions.
*   Contribute significantly to the entire software development lifecycle, from conceptualization and design to deployment and optimization, ensuring code quality, security, and maintainability.
*   Mentor junior developers and foster a culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement within the team.

**What We Are Looking For:**
*   Proven expertise as a Ruby developer with a strong portfolio of building complex, high-traffic backend systems.
*   Deep understanding of RESTful API design principles, microservices architecture, and cloud-native development, with significant experience on AWS.
*   Exceptional problem-solving acumen and a passion for tackling challenging, large-scale technical obstacles.
*   A collaborative spirit with excellent communication skills, capable of thriving in a fast-paced, agile environment.
*   A self-starter with an insatiable curiosity for new technologies and a commitment to continuous professional growth.
*   Experience with database design and optimization, particularly with large datasets.

**Why Join Us:**
Join a team of world-class innovators dedicated to making a profound, tangible impact on global sustainability and economic resilience. Experience unparalleled opportunities for professional development and direct influence on pioneering technological solutions. Work in a culture that champions intellectual curiosity, embraces audacious challenges, and rewards impactful contributions. We offer a highly competitive compensation package and a stimulating environment where your expertise directly contributes to changing the world.

**Application Process:**
If you are a top-tier developer eager to make a significant global impact alongside like-minded professionals, we encourage you to submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience.

title: Front-End/JavaScript Engineer
description: Workable is a product-driven software company. With thousands of enterprise users and millions in venture funding, we're building the best recruiting software in the world. A frictionless, usable, robust and highly scalable product that helps companies find and meet great people. The quality, design and usability of our software is what sets us apart from the competition. It's good to be an engineer in a company that values good engineering above all.We have a team of remarkably talented and friendly developers, a strong engineering culture and a dogged emphasis on customer-centric design. We're working on all sorts of exciting areas of application development: web, mobile, infrastructure, performance, ui/ux design, integrations with dozens of web services, API development, modern front-end frameworks, scalability, video, natural language processing, data science and usability engineering. Agile methodology and test-driven development are not things we read about in blogs, it's what we do every day.Our technology stack consists of a Rails app and a Java app running PostgreSQL and HBase DB on the Heroku and AWS. Our MVC architecture relies on REST APIs to connect internal building blocks and external systems. Some of the development and platform tools we use include jQuery, Backbone, Websolr, Redis, Braintree, Papertrail, New Relic and Mailgun.We're looking for developers in all fields of SaaS application development. We have several teams working on different areas from the core application to mobile/tablet applications, integrations, natural language processing, data science and video technology. We will find the right team for you depending on your skills and technology interests.We invest in training junior engineers (you will learn from the best) and re-training experienced developers in the technology stack we use. If you're an exceptionally good engineer who wants to work in a world-class software company, you're in the right place.
benefits: Our goal is to create a company where employees enjoy benefits that make them more productive and contribute directly to the development of their professional skills. We want to be able to attract the best of the best, and make sure they keep getting better. On top of an exciting, vibrant and intellectually challenging workplace and a competitive salary, we are offering:Stock option planPrivate health insurance planMobile telephony and data plan Free meals, snacks and beveragesWorkstation hardware of your choiceLicenses for the software and working tools of your choice Educational expenses for buying books, online seminars, etc, so long as the educational benefit is related to our workAttendance expenses paid for at least one developer conference or workshop of your choice per yearLending support to your personal experimentation and research projectsFlexible working hours, ability to work from homeWorkable is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We want applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

**Software Engineer - All Levels**

Workable stands as a pioneering force at the nexus of technology and talent acquisition. As a recognized market leader, our transformative software platform empowers thousands of enterprises globally to identify, engage, and onboard exceptional talent with unparalleled efficiency. We are unwavering in our commitment to engineering excellence, where innovative design, robust scalability, and intuitive usability converge to redefine industry standards and user experience.

**The Opportunity:**

We are seeking highly skilled and visionary Software Engineers to join our dynamic and highly talented engineering team. This is an unparalleled opportunity to contribute significantly to the ongoing evolution of a truly revolutionary product that is actively reshaping the future of recruiting. You will be instrumental in designing, developing, and deploying cutting-edge solutions across a diverse array of strategic technological domains. Your work will encompass advanced web and mobile applications, scalable infrastructure, intricate performance optimization, sophisticated UI/UX architectures, complex API integrations, and groundbreaking initiatives in natural language processing and data science. Our steadfast commitment to agile methodologies and test-driven development ensures a high-impact, collaborative environment where industry best practices are not merely aspirations but daily operational realities.

**Your Profile:**

We welcome applications from exceptional engineers across all experience levels – from promising junior talent eager to learn and grow within an advanced technology ecosystem, to seasoned professionals ready to apply their deep expertise to complex challenges. A demonstrated passion for innovation, a collaborative spirit, and a relentless pursuit of engineering perfection are paramount. You possess a curious mind and an unwavering commitment to continuous professional development.

**Our Technology Landscape:**

Our robust, modern architecture leverages Ruby on Rails and Java applications, supported by PostgreSQL and HBase databases, operating seamlessly on Heroku and AWS. We employ a sophisticated MVC design, orchestrating interconnected internal components and external services via RESTful APIs. Our comprehensive suite of development and platform tools includes, but is not limited limited to, jQuery, Backbone, Websolr, Redis, Braintree, Papertrail, New Relic, and Mailgun.

**Why Workable?**

At Workable, you will transcend conventional development to truly shape the future of a global industry. Join a culture that celebrates ingenuity, fosters continuous professional growth, and empowers you to make a profound, tangible impact on a global scale. If you are an architect of innovation, driven to create world-class software and lead the charge in technological advancement, your journey begins here.

refined_description:
**Aker Solutions: Solutions Design & Documentation Specialist (Global Project Close-out)**

**Company Overview:**
Aker Solutions stands as a globally preeminent leader in integrated energy solutions, driving innovation and sustainable progress across the international oil and gas industry. With a steadfast commitment to pioneering engineering, transformative design, and advanced technological solutions, we empower our clients to maximize resource recovery and achieve unparalleled operational excellence in the most challenging environments. Our expansive global footprint, supported by a diverse and highly skilled workforce, positions us at the forefront of the energy sector's evolution. At Aker Solutions, we cultivate an environment where individual expertise is paramount, and collective ingenuity converges to address the critical energy demands of tomorrow. We believe that true success is forged through a deep commitment to our people, our shared values, and an unwavering pursuit of engineering mastery.

**The Opportunity:**
We are seeking a highly motivated and meticulously detail-oriented **Solutions Design & Documentation Specialist** to join our elite project close-out team. This pivotal role is integral to the successful finalization and lifecycle management of our most complex and strategic global energy projects. As a key contributor, you will leverage your expertise to ensure the precision, integrity, and accessibility of critical technical documentation, directly influencing project milestones and operational readiness across international operations. This is an unparalleled opportunity to significantly impact high-profile initiatives within a dynamic and forward-thinking international enterprise.

**Key Responsibilities:**
*   Serve as the primary custodian for the finalization, meticulous archiving, and comprehensive lifecycle management of complex engineering designs and schematics, ensuring absolute technical accuracy and adherence to rigorous internal and international standards.
*   Proactively engage with cross-functional project teams, including engineering, operations, and client stakeholders, to gather comprehensive specifications and facilitate seamless information transfer for documentation closure.
*   Translate intricate conceptual designs and multi-disciplinary data into precise, high-fidelity CAD models and comprehensive technical drawings (e.g., Process & Instrumentation Diagrams, Electrical Schematics, Instrumentation Layouts) that meet advanced engineering requirements.
*   Strategically adapt and update existing documentation to reflect project modifications, revisions, and as-built conditions with impeccable attention to detail and thoroughness.
*   Exercise considerable autonomy in optimizing design layouts and documentation methodologies, contributing innovative solutions that enhance clarity, efficiency, and compliance.
*   Implement robust quality assurance protocols, conducting rigorous self-assessments and incorporating stakeholder feedback to guarantee the unimpeachable quality and integrity of all documentation deliverables.
*   Champion continuous improvement initiatives within the documentation lifecycle, identifying opportunities to streamline processes and elevate overall departmental excellence.
*   Ensure strict compliance with proprietary client document management protocols, industry regulations (e.g., ISO 9001), and our comprehensive internal management systems.

**What We Seek:**
*   Demonstrated mastery of industry-leading CAD software and advanced technical drawing methodologies.
*   Exceptional aptitude for interpreting complex engineering data and translating conceptual information into detailed, actionable schematics.
*   Vast experience in a similar role within a fast-paced, project-driven environment, preferably within the energy or heavy industrial sector.
*   Proactive problem-solver with a meticulous eye for detail and an unwavering commitment to quality.
*   Superior communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration with diverse global teams and senior stakeholders.
*   High degree of self-motivation, integrity, and the ability to manage multiple priorities independently while consistently meeting ambitious deadlines.
*   Proficiency in enterprise-level productivity suites (e.g., Microsoft Office 365, Project Management Software).
*   A Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Design, or a related technical discipline is highly preferred; extensive relevant experience may be considered in lieu.

**What We Offer:**
Join a globally recognized industry leader and contribute to projects of immense international significance. We foster an exceptionally dynamic and innovative work environment where professional growth is not just encouraged, but actively cultivated.
*   A highly competitive remuneration package commensurate with experience and impact.
*   Comprehensive, world-class benefits designed to support your well-being and professional trajectory.
*   Unparalleled opportunities for continuous professional development, specialized training, and long-term career advancement within a global framework.
*   A collaborative culture that values ingenuity, empowers individual contribution, and champions collective success.
*   The chance to work on transformative projects that redefine the future of energy.

**Application Process:**
Candidates meeting these distinguished qualifications are invited to submit their comprehensive CV and a compelling cover letter outlining their strategic alignment with this role and our organizational vision. Applications will be reviewed with utmost discretion, and shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an expedited virtual interview process.

refined_description:
**Instrumentation, Controls, and Electrical (IC&E) Technician**

**Location:** Bakersfield, CA (Mt. Poso Facility)

We are seeking a highly skilled and committed Instrumentation, Controls, and Electrical (IC&E) Technician to join our dynamic operational team at the Mt. Poso facility. This pivotal role is central to ensuring the optimal performance and reliability of our critical power generation infrastructure.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Orchestrate the full lifecycle management of sophisticated power plant instrumentation, intricate control systems, and complex electrical equipment, encompassing calibration, rigorous testing, proactive maintenance, advanced troubleshooting, and strategic installation.
*   Execute precision diagnostics and corrective actions on vital components including Motor Control Centers (MCCs), motor-operated valves, generators, excitation equipment, and high-performance motors.
*   Champion proactive, predictive, and corrective maintenance initiatives, collaborating seamlessly with diverse cross-functional teams to uphold unparalleled operational uptime.
*   Contribute to strategic infrastructure enhancement projects by designing and implementing new equipment integrations and system modifications.
*   Conduct in-depth troubleshooting and perform expert maintenance on DC backup power systems, intricate process controls, Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs), and advanced emission monitoring apparatus.
*   Leverage advanced enterprise asset management systems to meticulously document time, material utilization, issue resolution, and delineate future corrective actions, thereby creating a comprehensive historical record of equipment performance.
*   Oversee and collaborate with external partners and contractors, ensuring the seamless execution of specialized tasks and projects while adhering to stringent timelines and quality standards.
*   Champion a robust culture of safety and operational excellence, proactively identifying and mitigating potential hazards, and consistently upholding environmental compliance work practices.
*   Actively identify environmental non-compliance concerns and contribute to the implementation of sustainable and effective remediation strategies.
*   Contribute significantly to the collective success of the generating station by collaborating with all departments and assisting team members in achieving their shared performance objectives.
*   Mentor and empower colleagues through comprehensive knowledge transfer initiatives in the specialized domains of instrumentation, control, and electrical systems.
*   Contribute to maintaining an optimized, compliant, and efficient work environment through meticulous organization and upkeep.
*   Ensure adherence to all company and plant rules and regulations through precise equipment and system tagging protocols.
*   Conduct thorough equipment safety inspections as mandated, meticulously documenting findings and ensuring timely corrective measures.
*   Interpret and apply complex technical drawings, sketches, prints, and specifications to guide maintenance and project activities.
*   Manage critical inventory and procurement processes to ensure the timely availability of parts required for essential maintenance and repair operations.
*   Adapt dynamically to evolving operational demands, supporting critical cross-functional initiatives and undertaking additional tasks as assigned, including operations support on an as-needed basis.
*   Demonstrate unwavering commitment to operational continuity through an established on-call rotation and adaptable availability for critical response, including acceptable off-hour contact via phone and company pager.

**Essential Qualifications & Attributes:**

*   Exceptional interpersonal and technical communication proficiencies, fostering collaborative interactions across diverse disciplines and seniority levels.
*   Proven ability to coordinate complex work activities with internal and external stakeholders on highly technical subjects across various job functions.
*   Flexibility to align with dynamic operational schedules, including evening, weekend, and holiday shifts, as business needs dictate.

**Application Process:**

Serious inquiries from highly qualified candidates are invited to submit their application exclusively through our designated careers portal. Direct outreach via email or telephone will not be considered, and third-party recruitment agencies are respectfully requested not to contact us regarding this position.

title: Offshore Wellhead Technician
description: Corporate overviewAker Solutions is a global provider of products, systems and services to the oil and gas industry. Our engineering, design and technology bring discoveries into production and maximize recovery from each petroleum field. We employ approximately 28,000 people in about 30 countries. Go to #URL_0fa3f7c5e23a16de16a841e368006cae916884407d90b154dfef3976483a71ae# for more information on our business, people and values.We are looking for individuals who are prepared to take a position. Not only a position within Aker Solutions, but also a position on the exciting challenges the global oil and gas industry faces now and in the futureAker Solutions Houston (ASH) is established for the purpose of creating value for clients and owners by providing superior customer service to operators within the oil and gas industry. Superior customer service will be achieved through continual improvement, leadership involvement, demonstration of initiative, proactive anticipation of client demands, diligent attention to detail, and an effective HSE program designed to identify, report, and prevent unwanted conditions. ASA shall be a good corporate citizen acting in line with the interests of the US Authorities and the general public.Responsibilities and tasksObjectives:Ensure the preparation, planning and execution of operations to be performed either by Aker Solutions Houston or by subcontracted staff in the offshore team.Responsibilities/Activities:Operations:• Organise and perform offshore operations on-site.• Ensure that all maintenance and repair on facilities and equipment is carried out safely, efficiently and in full compliance with company operating procedures and statutory laws so that they remain in perfect and safe working conditions.• Review and maintain installation procedures.• Carry out other activities as designated by the line manager.• Conduct any activity within the scope of the post holder’s competences.• In the event of a system failure, take charge of systems for which the post holder is responsible until normal operation is restored.Team Coordination:• Work with the team to assist specialized staff working offshore.• Manage and participate in the installation of equipment delivered by Aker Solutions Houston.• Coordinate all team employees, including sub-suppliers, where appropriate.• Be present at shift-change meetings.• Maintain good customer communication.• Ensure daily communications with Onshore Operations.• Manage the team of technicians for which the post holder is responsible.Administrative Activities:• Write reports in accordance with the procedure reports.• Record offshore activities on the applicable form, including the completion of the following forms as needed: Meeting report & Incident report.• Update and archive all reports in binders provided by Aker Solutions Congo Onshore Support (to be delivered to Aker Solutions Houston once the installation is concluded).• Ensure that time sheets are signed by the customer before team members leave the platform.• Ensure that overtime has been authorised by the customer and recorded on the time sheets.• Establish a convenient time with the customer for trainees to work offshore (this should be coordinated with the line manager).Qualifications & personal attributes• Vocational training as a minimum. • 5 to 10 years’ offshore work experience.• Fluent in English and knowledge of French would be an advantage• User-level IT skills.

refined_description:
**Lead Offshore Operations Specialist**

**About Aker Solutions:**
Aker Solutions is a global leader in providing integrated solutions and services to the energy industry, specializing in the full lifecycle of oil and gas fields. With a robust global presence spanning over 30 countries and a workforce of approximately 28,000 dedicated professionals, we are at the forefront of engineering innovation, design, and technology, committed to maximizing resource recovery and shaping the future of energy. Our unwavering commitment to operational excellence, safety, and sustainable practices underpins our success and reputation as an industry pioneer.

**The Opportunity:**
Aker Solutions Houston is seeking an exceptionally skilled and dedicated Lead Offshore Operations Specialist to join our high-performing team. This pivotal role is central to ensuring the seamless execution of complex offshore operations, contributing directly to our mission of delivering superior client satisfaction and creating enduring value. We are looking for a proactive leader prepared to navigate the dynamic challenges and opportunities within the global energy landscape, making a tangible impact on critical projects.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic Operational Oversight:** Direct and meticulously oversee all phases of offshore operational initiatives, from comprehensive planning and resource allocation to execution and post-operation analysis, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and industry best practices.
*   **Asset Integrity & Compliance Management:** Implement and enforce rigorous maintenance and repair protocols for offshore facilities and sophisticated equipment, guaranteeing peak operational efficiency, strict adherence to company procedures, and full compliance with all relevant statutory and safety regulations.
*   **Procedural Advancement & Optimization:** Proactively review, refine, and champion the continuous improvement of installation and operational procedures, driving efficiency gains and enhancing safety standards across all activities.
*   **High-Stakes Incident Response:** Exercise decisive leadership and technical acumen in the event of system anomalies or failures, rapidly restoring normal operations and mitigating potential impacts on project timelines and safety.
*   **Leadership & Team Enablement:** Provide inspiring leadership and expert guidance to a diverse team of offshore technicians and specialized personnel, fostering a collaborative and high-performance culture. This includes direct involvement in managing and participating in complex equipment installations.
*   **Stakeholder Engagement & Communication:** Cultivate and maintain robust communication channels with onshore operations, sub-suppliers, and key client stakeholders, ensuring transparency, alignment, and proactive problem-solving. Facilitate critical shift-change briefings to ensure seamless operational transitions.
*   **Performance Analytics & Compliance Documentation:** Develop comprehensive analytical reports on offshore activities, meticulously documenting operational milestones, incident reports, and meeting outcomes. Ensure diligent adherence to all administrative protocols, including accurate timesheet verification, overtime authorization, and systematic archiving of critical project documentation.
*   **Talent Development & Mentorship:** Coordinate and facilitate valuable offshore work experiences for trainees, aligning their development with strategic operational needs and fostering the growth of future talent.

**Desired Qualifications & Attributes:**

*   A minimum of vocational training; advanced technical certifications or a degree in a relevant engineering discipline is highly advantageous.
*   Demonstrated experience of 5-10 years in complex offshore operational environments, with a proven track record of successful project execution and team leadership.
*   Fluency in English; proficiency in French is considered a distinct asset.
*   Advanced proficiency in industry-standard IT systems and operational software.
*   Exceptional leadership capabilities, with a proven ability to motivate, manage, and develop cross-functional teams in challenging environments.
*   Superior problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and the ability to make informed decisions under pressure.
*   Unwavering commitment to safety, quality, and operational excellence.
*   Outstanding interpersonal communication and stakeholder management skills.

**Why Aker Solutions?**
Joining Aker Solutions means becoming part of a global collective committed to innovation and impact. We offer a stimulating and dynamic work environment where your expertise is not just valued but crucial to our success. We provide highly competitive remuneration packages, comprehensive benefits, and unparalleled opportunities for professional growth and career advancement within a leading organization that values its people and their contributions. If you are an ambitious and results-oriented professional seeking to elevate your career within a company that is shaping the future of energy, we invite you to explore this exciting opportunity.

This position demands a resilient individual with an unwavering commitment to the foundational principle that unparalleled safety standards are inextricably linked to operational triumph.

refined_description:
**Position: Senior Operations Specialist, Hydrocarbon Processing**

**Location:** Bakersfield Area, California

Our organization is at the forefront of energy innovation, committed to operational excellence and sustainable practices within the hydrocarbon processing sector. We are currently seeking an accomplished and highly motivated Senior Operations Specialist to join our dynamic Bakersfield Operational team. This pivotal role offers the opportunity to contribute significantly to our critical infrastructure and drive continuous improvement in our field operations.

**Role Overview:**
The Senior Operations Specialist will be responsible for providing comprehensive operational, technical, diagnostic, and surveillance expertise across all facets of our producing oil wells, advanced oil treating facilities, integrated water softening and disposal systems, steam generation plants, and sophisticated vapor recovery (CVR) systems. This role is instrumental in ensuring peak operational efficiency, adherence to rigorous safety standards, and environmental stewardship.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Process Optimization:** Implement and oversee advanced processes for hydrocarbon dehydration to achieve stringent quality specifications (e.g., sub 3% BS&W).
*   **Operational Integrity & Troubleshooting:** Proactively identify, diagnose, and resolve complex production process anomalies, implementing safe and effective corrective actions to meet strategic business targets and uphold stringent HSE (Health, Safety, and Environment) goals.
*   **Maintenance & Project Collaboration:** Collaborate closely on the strategic planning and execution of maintenance, installation, and repair initiatives for critical oilfield production infrastructure.
*   **Strategic Planning & Execution:** Develop and implement robust operational plans, ensuring projects are executed safely, efficiently, and on schedule.
*   **Safety Leadership:** Champion and enforce industry-leading safety policies, developing and managing critical operational permits to ensure secure work environments within a hydrocarbon-rich setting.
*   **System Monitoring & Control:** Utilize advanced SCADA systems for real-time monitoring, conduct meticulous onsite surveillance, acquire critical plant readings, and perform comprehensive fluid analysis and system integrity assessments (piping/valve alignment reviews).
*   **Regulatory Compliance:** Ensure unwavering adherence to all corporate, state, and federal safety, environmental, and health regulations.
*   **Water & Steam Management:** Optimize steam generation and distribution, manage water flooding targets, and implement advanced produced water treatment methodologies for steam generation and disposal.
*   **Team & Contractor Oversight:** Provide leadership and oversight for maintenance crews and third-party contractors engaged in on-location equipment construction, repair, and commissioning.
*   **Data & Reporting:** Conduct comprehensive data acquisition and analytical reporting, leveraging functional proficiency in enterprise software suites including MS Office (specifically Excel) and SCADA systems, to inform daily and weekly performance reviews.

**Qualifications:**

*   Demonstrated experience in the operation, diagnostics, and optimization of complex oilfield production equipment and integrated systems.
*   Profound understanding and application of safety procedures and best practices within high-hazard hydrocarbon environments.
*   Exceptional diagnostic acumen for preemptive problem identification and strategic resolution planning.
*   Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to foster a highly collaborative and synergistic team environment.
*   Outstanding communication capabilities, both verbal and written, with the organizational agility to manage multiple priorities effectively.
*   Proficiency with industrial control systems (SCADA) and enterprise software, including the Microsoft Office Suite.

**Application Process:**
Qualified candidates are exclusively invited to submit their applications directly through our corporate careers portal. We are committed to a meticulous and fair selection process and appreciate your understanding that direct email inquiries or phone calls regarding this specific role will not be considered. We are exclusively managing this pivotal search internally and respectfully request no recruiter submissions.

Join us to shape the future of digital advertising.

From initial strategic alignment and seamless onboarding to comprehensive performance oversight and final reconciliation, you will be the primary architect of campaign excellence on our sophisticated proprietary platform.

You will serve as the crucial nexus between discerning media agencies, strategic publishing partners, and our internal cross-functional leadership, including Account Directors and Sales Directors. This collaborative synergy ensures not only the fulfillment but the consistent surpassing of client objectives. refined_description:
**Software Engineer | Forecasting + Optimization | San Mateo, CA**

A rapidly expanding leader in AI-driven data intelligence is seeking an exceptional Software Engineer to join our pioneering team, dedicated to architecting and deploying a transformative, next-generation platform for predictive analytics and strategic optimization. This pivotal role involves deep collaboration with our world-class research scientists and astute business strategists to craft innovative solutions that redefine efficiency and impact within the dynamic online engagement ecosystem. You will navigate and conquer multifaceted challenges at unprecedented scale, developing advanced models and algorithms to precisely estimate critical metrics such as granular user engagement probabilities, dynamic impression valuations, real-time supply dynamics, and sophisticated content classification, thereby fundamentally enhancing global digital strategy. Your contributions will involve harnessing vast, multi-terabyte datasets, extracting profound, actionable insights through cutting-edge data mining, statistical analysis, and machine learning techniques, directly shaping our product roadmap and market leadership.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Design, develop, and deploy high-performance predictive models leveraging immense datasets of complex digital interaction transactions.
*   Architect and implement robust statistical methodologies for discovering intricate patterns and unlocking hidden value within petabyte-scale data repositories.
*   Conceptualize, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B testing frameworks to empirically validate and optimize strategic interventions and algorithmic improvements, driving measurable business impact.
*   Engineer and refine sophisticated data extraction pipelines using advanced SQL and diverse query languages to acquire, transform, and filter mission-critical information with unparalleled precision.
*   Lead deep-dive analyses on massive, evolving datasets, translating raw data into comprehensive business intelligence and illuminating underlying market dynamics for executive decision-making.
*   Champion best practices in statistical sciences, data engineering, and machine learning, fostering a culture of technical excellence and contributing to the intellectual capital of the organization across cross-functional teams.
*   Proactively identify emerging trends and technological opportunities, proposing and prototyping innovative solutions that push the boundaries of current capabilities.

refined_description:
**Instrument, Controls, and Electrical (IC&E) Technician | Bakersfield, CA**

We kindly request that all applications be submitted through this platform to ensure fair and organized processing. Recruitment agencies are respectfully requested to refrain from submitting unsolicited resumes.

**About the Opportunity:**
We are seeking a highly skilled and results-oriented Instrument, Controls, and Electrical (IC&E) Technician to join our dynamic team in Bakersfield, CA. This pivotal role is integral to maintaining the operational integrity and advanced capabilities of our critical power generation facilities. We champion innovation and empower our professionals to contribute to a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Execute precision calibration, testing, maintenance, troubleshooting, and installation of complex power plant instrumentation, sophisticated control systems, and critical electrical apparatus.
*   Conduct comprehensive diagnostics and corrective maintenance on motor control centers, actuated valves, generation systems, excitation modules, and various motor types.
*   Implement proactive preventive, predictive, and corrective maintenance programs, fostering seamless collaboration with cross-functional teams.
*   Contribute to the strategic design and flawless integration of new equipment and system enhancements.
*   Diagnose and resolve complex issues within DC backup power systems, advanced process control architectures, Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs), and critical environmental emission monitoring apparatus.
*   Meticulously document all maintenance activities, resource utilization, issue resolution, and follow-up requirements within the designated Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to ensure comprehensive asset history.
*   Oversee and coordinate specialized contractor engagements, ensuring adherence to project timelines and quality standards.
*   Uphold and champion stringent safety protocols, proactively identifying potential hazards and proposing innovative mitigation strategies.
*   Ensure strict adherence to all environmental compliance standards, identifying and addressing any deviations with swift, effective solutions.
*   Foster a collaborative environment by providing expert technical support to colleagues and cross-departmental teams, contributing directly to operational excellence targets.
*   Act as a Subject Matter Expert, mentoring and developing team capabilities in advanced instrumentation, control, and electrical systems.
*   Maintain a meticulous and organized work environment, adhering to all operational cleanliness standards.
*   Strictly adhere to Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) procedures and equipment isolation protocols to ensure operational safety.
*   Execute thorough safety inspections of critical equipment, meticulously documenting findings for compliance and continuous improvement.
*   Engage in and provide technical expertise for minor capital projects and infrastructure upgrades.
*   Proficiently interpret complex technical schematics, blueprints, and engineering specifications.
*   Manage inventory and initiate procurement of specialized components and consumables required for operational continuity.
*   Exhibit adaptability by performing diverse operational support functions and other high-priority initiatives as directed.

**Qualifications & Attributes:**

*   Demonstrate unwavering commitment to operational readiness through availability for emergency response, flexible overtime, and consistent off-hours accessibility via designated communication channels.
*   Possess exceptional verbal and written communication prowess, adept at articulating complex technical information and fostering seamless inter-departmental coordination.
*   Embrace a dynamic work schedule, including weekends, holidays, and rotational shifts, to meet the evolving demands of a mission-critical environment.

refined_description:
**Communications Manager | New York, NY, United States**

At [Company Name], we are at the vanguard of innovation, empowering brand advertisers, agencies, publishers, and ad networks to intelligently, effectively, and securely orchestrate billions of video ad trades programmatically each month across Web, mobile, and linear TV platforms. Our marketing and communications collective operates cohesively across all departments, crafting and disseminating the compelling narrative of our global market leadership. We are dedicated to delivering the right message to the right audience at the optimal moment, and invite visionary storytellers to contribute to our world-class team.

We are seeking a highly strategic and dynamic Communications Manager to join our New York City offices, reporting directly to the Director of Communications. While contributing to our overarching global communications strategy spanning APAC and EMEA regions, this pivotal role will primarily focus on amplifying our presence within the North American market. We are particularly interested in exceptional writers with an innate ability to distil complex concepts into clear, engaging narratives, driven by a passion for transforming bold ideas into tangible realities. A profound understanding of the media and technology landscape, including emerging trends and influential stakeholders, is essential.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Orchestrate and execute a sophisticated editorial and communications calendar, strategically enhancing our visibility at industry-defining events and within key target media.
*   Pioneer comprehensive content creation initiatives, encompassing impactful press releases, thought leadership articles, executive communications, and compelling digital narratives across diverse channels.
*   Cultivate a proactive approach to content innovation, consistently bringing forward novel ideas and meticulously guiding them from conceptualization to impactful realization.
*   Leverage advanced analytics and insights to quantify the strategic impact of communication efforts across an evolving digital and social media ecosystem, with a focus on platforms such as Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and emerging channels.
*   Forge and nurture strategic relationships with critical trade, business, and technology media outlets, meticulously positioning [Company Name]'s executive leadership as definitive thought leaders and industry pioneers.
*   Provide pivotal support across integrated traditional public relations and advanced digital media programs, both internally and externally.

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply directly to this job posting. Direct email or phone inquiries are not being considered at this time. We appreciate your cooperation. Recruiters are kindly requested not to contact us regarding this position.

refined_description:
**Director of Engineering**

**HMA Security Products | San Jose, CA**

HMA Security Products, a rapidly evolving leader in advanced security solutions, is seeking a visionary and results-driven Director of Engineering to join our dynamic team. Reporting directly to the VP of Service Provider Engineering, this pivotal role will hold ultimate accountability for shaping the strategic direction, architectural integrity, and successful end-to-end delivery of our market-defining security product portfolio.

The successful candidate will cultivate and empower a high-performing engineering cohort while orchestrating complex, multi-faceted engagements with a diverse ecosystem of strategic technology partners. This encompasses pioneering chipset innovators, leading Original Design Manufacturers (ODMs), disruptive new technology ventures, and integral third-party software developers, ensuring synergistic collaborations that accelerate our innovation pipeline.

As the primary engineering authority, you will collaborate intimately with our Product Marketing and C-Suite leadership to architect and champion a transformative product and solutions roadmap. Your leadership will be paramount in defining the optimal engineering paradigms, encompassing groundbreaking product architectures, astute technology partner selection, meticulous resource allocation, rigorous testing methodologies, aggressive product scheduling, cost optimization, and seamless New Product Introduction (NPI) planning. You will then meticulously guide your teams and external partners to transcend project objectives and deliver unparalleled market impact.

You will spearhead critical customer engagement initiatives, navigating complex certification processes and fostering deep strategic alliances to secure widespread product adoption. Post-launch, you will champion customer success, working synergistically with Sales and Technical Support to ensure an exceptional user experience and sustained product excellence, driving continuous improvement cycles.

**Key Qualifications & Experience:**

*   A proven dual-threat leader with exceptional acumen in both engineering management and deep technical expertise across complex security products, network infrastructure (routers, switches, wireless), and hands-on IP networking. VoIP expertise is a distinct advantage.
*   An established, highly reputable figure within the networking industry, with a demonstrable track record of influence and thought leadership.
*   Minimum of 10 years of progressive, demonstrable success in senior engineering leadership within communications networking hardware and software, ideally leveraging Test-Driven Development (TDD) methodologies.
*   Exceptional command of intricate project and program management principles, robust risk mitigation strategies, and sophisticated third-party vendor management.
*   A compelling portfolio of successful product developments achieved through masterful orchestration of external resources and strategic partnerships, with a strong preference for extensive ODM development experience.
*   A recognized talent magnet, adept at identifying, nurturing, and retaining an elite cohort of engineering professionals, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
*   An undeniable presence who commands the respect and trust of both customers and strategic technology partners, serving as a guiding authority.
*   A unique blend of experience, having thrived for at least 5 years within the agile, high-growth environment of a smaller enterprise, coupled with 5+ years navigating the complexities and scale of a mature, market-leading corporation.
*   An inspirational team player and influential communicator, adept at fostering seamless cross-functional synergy and articulating complex technical vision across all organizational tiers, from individual contributors to executive leadership.
*   A fervent advocate for continuous quality enhancement, possessing a demonstrated mastery in implementing pragmatic, high-impact process optimizations that yield superior engineering outcomes.
*   A perpetual innovator, relentlessly pursuing and strategically integrating the vanguard of emerging technological trends and sophisticated engineering methodologies to propel organizational advancement.

refined_description:
**Senior Subsea Process Engineer / Architect**

**Company Overview:**
Aker Solutions is a global leader pioneering transformative solutions across the oil and gas value chain. With a rich heritage of innovation and a significant global footprint, we are dedicated to maximizing recovery and optimizing operations through cutting-edge engineering, design, and technology. We are not just anticipating the future of energy; we are actively shaping it, particularly within the revolutionary domain of subsea processing. Join our visionary team as we drive the next generation of industry advancements and establish the 'subsea factory' of tomorrow.

**The Opportunity:**
We are seeking highly driven and strategic engineering professionals to join our elite Subsea Power and Process Unit in Houston, TX. This is an unparalleled opportunity to contribute to projects that are redefining industry benchmarks and delivering critical infrastructure for global energy demands. You will assume a pivotal role within an agile, multidisciplinary team, driving conceptualization and development of advanced subsea processing technologies.

**Key Responsibilities:**
*   Lead and strategically guide the evolution of next-generation Subsea Factory technologies and concepts from initial ideation through to market readiness.
*   Provide expert technical leadership and strategic oversight for subsea process plant disciplines within complex global projects and advanced feasibility studies.
*   Architect innovative conceptual layouts and modularization philosophies for advanced subsea processing systems, ensuring optimal performance, integrity, and scalability.
*   Articulate and champion pioneering subsea process solutions to internal stakeholders and high-profile international clientele, influencing key strategic decisions and fostering collaborative partnerships.
*   Drive a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing, leveraging cutting-edge methodologies and fostering cross-functional excellence.

**Qualifications:**
*   Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (e.g., Mechanical, Chemical, Petroleum, Ocean) from a reputable institution.
*   Demonstrated experience (minimum 5-7 years preferred) in a demanding engineering or technical leadership capacity, ideally within the energy, maritime, or complex industrial systems sectors.
*   Exceptional analytical capabilities, a profound problem-solving orientation, and a commitment to innovation.
*   Proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative, and globally-connected professional environment.
*   Superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the capacity to engage diverse technical and executive audiences.
*   Proactive mindset with a commitment to continuous professional development and shaping future industry paradigms.

**What We Offer:**
Aker Solutions is committed to the holistic well-being and accelerated professional growth of our team members. We provide:
*   An extraordinary opportunity to make a tangible, far-reaching impact on global energy solutions.
*   A highly competitive compensation package commensurate with experience and significant contribution.
*   Comprehensive benefits designed to support your health, wealth, and professional-personal integration.
*   Access to state-of-the-art technology, world-class resources, and unparalleled opportunities for international collaboration.
*   A dynamic culture that champions innovation, diversity, continuous learning, and individual empowerment.

**Application Process:**
Interested candidates who meet these qualifications are invited to submit a comprehensive resume and a compelling cover letter outlining their relevant experience and vision for contributing to our subsea initiatives. Our talent acquisition team will review applications with utmost discretion.

refined_description:
**Senior Offshore Operations & Asset Integrity Lead**

**Corporate Overview:**

Aker Solutions stands as a global vanguard in delivering pioneering solutions to the oil and gas sector. Our relentless pursuit of engineering excellence, innovative design, and transformative technology empowers the conversion of nascent discoveries into productive assets, maximizing global energy recovery. With a dedicated workforce spanning approximately 30 countries, we are defining the future of energy. At Aker Solutions, we champion individuals who are prepared not only to embrace a significant role within our organization but also to proactively address the complex and evolving challenges facing the global energy landscape.

Our Houston operational hub is strategically positioned to create unparalleled value for our esteemed clientele and stakeholders. We achieve this through the consistent delivery of superior customer service, underpinned by an unwavering commitment to continuous improvement, empowering leadership, proactive anticipation of client demands, meticulous attention to detail, and a robust HSE framework designed for comprehensive risk mitigation and prevention. As a responsible corporate entity, we operate in full alignment with regulatory authorities and the broader public interest.

**Role Overview:**

We are seeking a highly experienced and results-driven Senior Offshore Operations & Asset Integrity Lead to oversee critical field operations, ensure optimal asset performance, and lead dedicated technical teams in challenging offshore environments. This pivotal role demands exceptional leadership, technical acumen, and a meticulous approach to documentation and compliance.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Operational Excellence & Asset Management:**
    *   Orchestrate and execute complex offshore operational campaigns, ensuring peak efficiency, stringent safety protocols, and full compliance with corporate and statutory regulations.
    *   Oversee comprehensive maintenance and meticulous repair activities on critical facilities and equipment, guaranteeing optimal operational readiness and sustained asset integrity.
    *   Lead the rigorous review, refinement, and implementation of installation, maintenance, and operational procedures.
    *   Drive responsive action and effective resolution during system anomalies or critical failures, restoring functionality with minimal disruption.
*   **Strategic Team Leadership & Coordination:**
    *   Provide expert guidance and collaborate seamlessly with specialized offshore personnel, including subcontracted teams, fostering a high-performance, safety-conscious environment.
    *   Direct and actively participate in the precision installation and commissioning of advanced equipment solutions delivered by Aker Solutions.
    *   Synchronize all team resources, including external partners and sub-suppliers, to ensure cohesive project execution and adherence to timelines.
    *   Facilitate critical shift-change briefings, ensuring seamless operational handover and continuity.
    *   Cultivate and maintain exemplary client relationships, serving as a primary point of contact for operational matters and ensuring superior service delivery.
    *   Ensure transparent and consistent daily communication flow with Onshore Operations, maintaining full situational awareness and strategic alignment.
    *   Mentor, manage, and empower a dedicated team of technical professionals, fostering their development and performance excellence.
*   **Advanced Documentation & Compliance:**
    *   Author comprehensive, high-quality operational, incident, and technical reports in strict adherence to established corporate documentation standards.
    *   Maintain meticulous digital and physical records of all offshore activities, encompassing detailed meeting logs, incident reports, and operational summaries, ensuring absolute data integrity and audit readiness.
    *   Implement robust document control protocols for all generated reports, facilitating efficient archival, swift retrieval, and insightful analysis.
    *   Oversee the meticulous validation and client endorsement of all team timesheets and authorized overtime, ensuring accuracy and compliance with contractual agreements.
    *   Strategically coordinate and schedule offshore engagement opportunities for trainee personnel, aligning with operational demands and developmental objectives.

**Qualifications:**

*   Proven extensive experience in offshore oil and gas operations, encompassing maintenance, safety, and leadership roles.
*   In-depth understanding of international statutory regulations and industry best practices relevant to offshore asset integrity and operations.
*   Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to manage diverse teams and cultivate strong client relationships.
*   Demonstrated aptitude for meticulous documentation, comprehensive data management, and unwavering compliance adherence.
*   Proactive problem-solver with a steadfast commitment to operational excellence, continuous improvement, and a robust safety culture.

**Why Join Us:**

*   **Impactful Contribution:** Play a pivotal role in critical global energy operations, contributing directly to the industry's future.
*   **Professional Growth:** Access unparalleled opportunities for career advancement and specialized skill development within a leading international organization.
*   **Innovative Environment:** Work with cutting-edge technology and contribute to transformative industry solutions in a dynamic and challenging setting.
*   **Collaborative Culture:** Thrive in a supportive and high-performing team environment focused on shared success and collective expertise.
*   **Competitive Package:** We offer a highly competitive compensation structure and comprehensive benefits, recognizing the expertise and dedication required for this paramount role.

**To Apply:**

Submit your detailed professional resume and a compelling cover letter outlining your relevant experience and leadership philosophy.
