**Communications Manager**

**Location:** New York, NY, United States

[Company Name] stands at the forefront of programmatic video advertising, empowering brand advertisers, agencies, publishers, and ad networks to intelligently plan, execute, and measure billions of video ad transactions across an evolving digital landscape. Our Marketing and Communications team is integral to showcasing our market leadership globally, operating in close synergy across all departments. We are driven by a passion for precision storytelling – delivering the right message to the right audience at the optimal moment. If you are eager to contribute to a world-class communications initiative, we invite you to share your unique narrative with us.

We are seeking a dynamic and visionary Communications Manager to join our New York City team, reporting directly to the Director of Communications. While contributing to our overarching global communications strategy spanning APAC and EMEA, this critical role will primarily focus on amplifying our presence within the North American market. We are particularly interested in candidates who possess exceptional writing prowess, a demonstrated ability to distill complex ideas into compelling, accessible narratives, and an unwavering drive to transform innovative concepts into impactful realities. A robust understanding of the media and technology sectors, including key industry trends and influential stakeholders, is essential.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic Content Orchestration:** Develop and execute a comprehensive editorial and communications calendar that strategically amplifies our brand presence at pivotal industry events and across targeted media outlets.
*   **Narrative Crafting & Dissemination:** Lead the creation of engaging and authoritative content, encompassing press releases, thought leadership articles, executive communications, and compelling marketing copy, ensuring consistent brand voice and messaging.
*   **Innovation & Impact:** Proactively identify emerging content opportunities and pioneer innovative communication strategies, translating conceptual frameworks into tangible, high-impact campaigns.
*   **Digital Brand Amplification:** Leverage advanced digital and social media platforms (with a focus on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook) to maximize brand visibility, foster community engagement, and demonstrate the measurable business impact of our communications initiatives.
*   **Media Relations & Thought Leadership:** Cultivate and nurture high-level relationships with key trade, business, and technology media, strategically positioning [Company Name] executives as authoritative thought leaders on pertinent industry topics.
*   **Integrated Program Support:** Provide comprehensive support for both traditional public relations and dynamic digital media programs, ensuring seamless execution across internal and external stakeholders.

**Application Process:**

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply directly through our designated online portal. To ensure an equitable and streamlined selection process, we kindly request that all inquiries and applications be submitted exclusively via this platform. Direct emails or unsolicited phone calls to our team regarding this opening are not considered, and we do not engage with third-party recruitment agencies for this specific role. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation.

title: Senior System Test Engineer
description: Senior System Test Engineer | San Jose, CAAs a member of the Service Provider Engineering team, you will be responsible for the design quality of DSL products with specific emphasis on IADs (VoIP).    Our DSL and Cable broadband products address Home Gateway, IPTV and Voice over IP (VoIP) services and are targeted at service providers.  These products will incorporate one or several of the following technologies:  DSL, PPPoX, DNS/DHCP, IP, SIP, IGMP, 802.11 Wireless, Ethernet, VPN, Firewalls, 3G / LTE.Job ResponsibilitiesMonitor and oversee the ODM quality processes and QA test, and verify test coverage.Work within the engineering development organization to verify the design quality of DSL products.Perform product testing to verify product performance and diagnose product defects.Perform verification and regression testing for bug fixes.  Log, track and drive to closure all bugs directly with overseas developers.Develop test plans from requirements and supervise QA testing both within our company and in overseas supplier’s labs.Set up and maintain in-house DSL, 3G / LTE, VoIP and IPTV Network test bedMonitor/Manage qualification of products with customers and understand customer requirements and test plans.Create additional test cases as required to cover customer’s requirements.Send regular Test Status Reports to product team with metrics to indicate overall test progress and product maturity.Provide input for manuals, help files, application notes and tech support web pagesSupport any 3rd level technical escalations from our technical support.Evaluate new products and reference designs.

refined_description:
**Senior System Test Engineer | San Jose, CA**

Join a dynamic, forward-thinking organization at the forefront of telecommunications innovation. As a pivotal member of our Service Provider Engineering team, you will be instrumental in shaping the unparalleled quality and performance of our next-generation broadband solutions, with a specialized focus on Integrated Access Devices (IADs) and Voice over IP (VoIP) technologies. Our cutting-edge DSL and Cable broadband product portfolio delivers transformative Home Gateway, IPTV, and VoIP services to a discerning global clientele of service providers. This role demands mastery across a spectrum of advanced technologies, including but not limited to: DSL, PPPoX, DNS/DHCP, IP, SIP, IGMP, 802.11 Wireless, Ethernet, VPN, Firewalls, and 3G / LTE.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Provide strategic oversight and rigorous validation of Original Design Manufacturer (ODM) quality assurance processes, ensuring comprehensive test coverage and adherence to elite performance benchmarks.
*   Collaborate synergistically with cross-functional engineering teams to embed quality assurance principles throughout the product development lifecycle for our advanced DSL solutions.
*   Execute sophisticated performance validation protocols and intricate diagnostic analyses to identify and mitigate system anomalies in complex product architectures.
*   Orchestrate comprehensive verification and regression testing cycles, meticulously documenting and proactively managing the resolution of critical defects in direct collaboration with our global development partners.
*   Architect robust test methodologies and detailed validation plans derived from evolving product requirements, providing strategic guidance and oversight for QA initiatives across internal teams and international vendor laboratories.
*   Design, implement, and meticulously maintain state-of-the-art in-house network test environments spanning DSL, 3G/LTE, VoIP, and IPTV ecosystems, ensuring optimal simulation fidelity for product validation.
*   Lead and manage the rigorous qualification of product solutions with key client stakeholders, translating complex customer requirements and test paradigms into actionable validation strategies.
*   Innovate and develop bespoke test scenarios to comprehensively address emergent client-specific performance criteria and compliance demands.
*   Articulate insightful, data-driven progress reports to cross-functional product leadership, leveraging key performance indicators to communicate testing advancements and product readiness with unparalleled clarity.
*   Contribute expert technical guidance and critical content for comprehensive product documentation, including user manuals, knowledge base articles, and technical support resources, ensuring accuracy and utility.
*   Serve as a pivotal technical authority for escalated Level 3 support inquiries, delivering expert resolution to complex, high-priority issues.
*   Conduct forward-looking evaluations of nascent product innovations and reference architectures, providing strategic recommendations for future technological integration.

The Director of Engineering and their team of engineers will then be responsible for determining the best engineering approach to realizing that roadmap, including product architectures, selection of technology partners, resource planning, test planning, product scheduling, costing, and NPI planning. Demonstrated ability to use lightweight processes to improve engineering results.Can stay on top of and apply the latest technology trends and engineering processes for the organization.

refined_description:
**Director of Engineering, Security Products | San Jose, CA**

Reporting directly to the VP of Service Provider Engineering, the Director of Engineering will assume pivotal responsibility for spearheading the comprehensive lifecycle management and strategic deployment of our cutting-edge Security products and solutions. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of network security within a dynamic and rapidly evolving landscape, driving innovation at the forefront of the industry.

The successful candidate will cultivate and inspire a high-performing engineering team, while simultaneously orchestrating strategic collaborations with a diverse ecosystem of external technology partners. This includes, but is not limited to, vital engagements with chipset providers, leading ODMs, disruptive new technology start-ups, and premier third-party software innovators. As a preeminent engineering leader, you will collaborate seamlessly with Product Marketing to define the strategic product roadmap, translating visionary concepts into actionable development initiatives.

The Director of Engineering and their elite team will then be entrusted with architecting robust, scalable, and innovative engineering strategies, encompassing optimal product architectures, judicious selection of technology partners, precise resource planning, comprehensive test methodologies, aggressive product scheduling, meticulous costing, and streamlined New Product Introduction (NPI) planning. Your leadership will guarantee the successful realization of ambitious project milestones and transformative market impact.

Furthermore, this role involves direct engagement with key clients to ensure seamless product adoption, certification, and integration. Post-launch, the Director will partner extensively with Sales and Technical Support to uphold unparalleled customer satisfaction and unwavering product quality objectives.

**Key Leadership Accountabilities:**

*   Proven duality as a charismatic leader and a deep technical authority, possessing profound expertise in network security architectures, encompassing routing, switching, wireless, and sophisticated IP networking protocols. VoIP experience is a distinct advantage.
*   A recognized thought leader with an established reputation within the global networking community.
*   A minimum of 10 years of progressive, demonstrably successful engineering leadership within complex communications networking hardware and software environments, with a commitment to agile methodologies and contemporary development practices.
*   Exceptional acumen in advanced program and risk management, particularly within multi-vendor ecosystems and intricate partnership frameworks.
*   Pioneering experience in leveraging external innovation and strategic partnerships, including substantial ODM engagement, to accelerate product development and market penetration.
*   A proven ability to attract, develop, and retain elite engineering talent, fostering a culture of relentless innovation and high-performance.
*   An influential figure, inspiring trust and direction among key customers and strategic technology partners alike.
*   Diverse experience spanning at least 5 years in agile, high-growth startup environments and an additional 5 years within established, market-leading enterprises.
*   A collaborative visionary, adept at navigating complex organizational matrices and articulating strategic initiatives across all stakeholder levels.
*   A fervent commitment to continuous quality enhancement and the strategic deployment of adaptive, high-impact engineering processes.
*   A relentless pursuit of technological foresight, consistently integrating emergent trends and avant-garde engineering paradigms to ensure market leadership.

title: Assembly & Test Engineer
description: Corporate overviewAker Solutions is a global provider of products, systems and services to the oil and gas industry. Our engineering, design and technology bring discoveries into production and maximize recovery from each petroleum field. We employ approximately 28,000 people in about 30 countries. Go to #URL_0fa3f7c5e23a16de16a841e368006cae916884407d90b154dfef3976483a71ae# for more information on our business, people and values.We are looking for individuals who are prepared to take a position. Not only a position within Aker Solutions, but also a position on the exciting challenges the global oil and gas industry faces now and in the future.Aker Solutions' Subsea team based in Houston, TX is responsible for design, engineering, procurement and assembly/test of complex subsea systems. We need new talents who can strengthen our team and support our ambitious growth plans within the subsea market. We are looking for: Assembly & Test Engineer.Responsibilities and tasks • Assembly and Test Engineer initiates work tasks to be carried out by the workshop, follows the quality standards and plans the use of resources in order to increase the efficiency of the organization• Responsible for delivering on time according to plans and manages the day-to-day work tasks in a cost effective, safe, and efficient manner• Create work orders and issue work packages in accordance with contract/project requirements and according to procedure• Arrange and call for pre-job meeting with work shop personnel • Participate on hand-over (tool box) meetings in work shop• Responsible for updating work packages related to specific project needsor NCR (CQN) reports• Follow-up progress in workshop and respond without delay on requests for support• Making requisitions towards supply chain to handle unplanned activities• Inform project manager or line manager when Variation Orders is required, for additional work on existing SOW or when change in original SOW• Continuously verify that all relevant documents are completed according to job package procedure • Evaluate the risk of operations and the compliance with laws, standards and policies• Participates in SAFOP/SJA and other HSE related activities in WS• Make sure that special tools and equipment to the planned work (according to work order/package) in assigned projects are available and certified • Control/monitor that necessary materials are received and in place before start of assembly and test• Contribute to the design and improvement of special tools to perform the work in the workshop• Inform and if applicable submit formal status reports to project manager on assigned work tasks/SOW • Write NCRs when deviation is detected• Provide Project manager with input to lessons learned• Participate and contribute with expertise in Tender work
benefits: We offer • Friendly colleagues in an industry with a bright future.• An environment where you are encouraged to develop your skills and share your knowledge with your colleagues.• Competitive benefits and strong focus on work-life balance.
refined_description:
**Aker Solutions: Assembly & Test Engineer**

**About Aker Solutions:**
Aker Solutions is a global leader pioneering sophisticated products, systems, and services for the evolving energy industry. We are at the forefront of engineering, design, and technology, transforming resource discoveries into sustainable production and maximizing recovery from complex fields worldwide. With a diverse team of professionals across approximately 30 countries, we are committed to shaping the future of global energy. Explore our innovative spirit and core values at [Placeholder for URL, as original was a broken link].

**The Opportunity:**
We seek highly ambitious and proactive individuals prepared to contribute significantly to an industry-defining enterprise. This is more than just a position within Aker Solutions; it's an invitation to take a decisive stance on the exhilarating challenges and transformative opportunities facing the global energy sector, now and into the future.

Our Subsea team, strategically located in Houston, TX, is a cornerstone of our operations, driving the design, engineering, procurement, assembly, and testing of highly complex subsea systems. We are expanding our exceptional team and require key talents to fortify our ambitious growth trajectory within the subsea market. We are actively seeking a dedicated and results-oriented professional for the role of: **Assembly & Test Engineer**.

**Key Responsibilities:**
The Assembly & Test Engineer will be instrumental in ensuring operational excellence and strategic delivery within our dynamic workshop environment. This role offers significant autonomy and impact, encompassing:

*   Orchestrating complex assembly and testing sequences, ensuring optimal resource allocation and unwavering adherence to stringent quality benchmarks to enhance overall operational efficiency.
*   Driving timely project completion and upholding an uncompromising commitment to safety, cost-effectiveness, and operational excellence across all initiatives.
*   Formulating and disseminating comprehensive work packages, meticulously aligning with contractual obligations and procedural protocols.
*   Facilitating pivotal pre-job briefings with workshop teams, fostering seamless communication and proactive problem-solving.
*   Actively engaging in critical handover sessions and daily operational briefings, contributing expert insights and strategic direction.
*   Ensuring dynamic adaptation of work packages in response to evolving project requirements or non-conformance reports, maintaining absolute data integrity.
*   Proactively monitoring workshop progress, providing immediate, expert support to mitigate any operational challenges and sustain workflow momentum.
*   Orchestrating precise and timely requisitions to the supply chain for unforeseen operational needs, ensuring uninterrupted project continuity.
*   Strategically advising project and line leadership on the necessity of Variation Orders, accurately documenting scope deviations or expansions to ensure commercial alignment.
*   Maintaining meticulous oversight of all project documentation, verifying rigorous adherence to procedural mandates and regulatory requirements.
*   Conducting comprehensive risk assessments for all operational phases, ensuring unwavering compliance with all statutory, industry, and organizational safety standards.
*   Championing HSE initiatives, actively contributing to Safety Operational Assessments (SAFOP) and Job Safety Analyses (SJA), fostering a culture of paramount safety.
*   Guaranteeing the timely provision and certification of all specialized tooling and equipment essential for project execution.
*   Verifying the meticulous preparation and availability of all requisite materials prior to the commencement of assembly and testing phases.
*   Innovating and contributing to the evolution of specialized tooling and methodologies, continually optimizing workshop productivity and efficiency.
*   Providing comprehensive and formal status reports to project leadership, offering transparent insights into work task progression and critical milestones.
*   Documenting Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs) with precision and clarity upon identifying any operational deviations.
*   Contributing strategic insights for 'Lessons Learned' initiatives, fostering continuous improvement and knowledge transfer across projects.
*   Lending specialized expertise to critical tender processes, influencing future project acquisition and strategic growth.

This role represents an exceptional opportunity for a driven individual to make a tangible impact within a globally recognized organization, contributing to groundbreaking projects and shaping the future of energy infrastructure.

refined_description:
**Lead Software Engineer, Agricultural Innovation**

Are you driven to revolutionize a foundational industry and make a tangible impact on global food security? Do you thrive at the vanguard of technological advancement, eager to tackle formidable challenges with real-world implications? Our organization is pioneering transformative solutions at the intersection of agricultural science and advanced technology, and we are seeking a visionary technical leader to shape our next generation of core products and services.

As a Lead Software Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in orchestrating the end-to-end development lifecycle of our proprietary platforms, guiding their evolution from conceptualization to deployment. You will not only champion engineering excellence and best practices but also cultivate a high-performance culture, mentoring and inspiring a talented team of engineers to achieve their fullest potential.

**Key Responsibilities:**
*   Drive strategic technical initiatives, influencing architectural decisions and future roadmap direction for our cutting-edge solutions.
*   Lead the design, development, and deployment of robust, scalable, and high-quality software solutions that address critical industry needs.
*   Foster a collaborative and innovative environment, encouraging continuous learning and knowledge sharing within and across teams.
*   Provide astute technical guidance and constructive feedback, elevating the capabilities of both junior and senior engineers.
*   Navigate complex technical challenges with proactive problem-solving, ensuring elegant and resilient system implementations.
*   Identify and integrate emergent technologies that align with our strategic objectives, enhancing product capabilities and operational efficiency.

**Qualifications:**
*   Exceptional leadership acumen with 2+ years of direct managerial experience guiding high-performing software engineering teams (3+ engineers).
*   Profound expertise in web technologies and complex web application architectures.
*   Extensive hands-on experience (6+ years) with enterprise-grade development in Ruby and/or Java.
*   Proficiency in designing, optimizing, and interacting with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL).
*   Adeptness with modern distributed version control systems, particularly Git.
*   Superior strategic communication, organizational, and analytical capabilities, with a knack for translating complex technical concepts into clear objectives and actionable plans.

Join us in building a future where innovation empowers progress and impacts millions.

refined_description:

title: Sr. Systems Engineering Manager
description: SUMMARY:   The Sr. Systems Engineering Manager is responsible for defining product system architecture including chipset selection, HW architecture, HW/FW split, system memory requirements and SW architecture for all Service Provider Business Unit products. This will include developing and maintaining products functional specifications, technical presentations, RFP responses and technical articles (white papers, case studies, and trade pub article placements). The systems architect works closely with Product Line Managers (PLMs), R&D, HW & Software development teams and ODM partners to ensure all key aspects of the systems architecture are addressed and implemented for success of the product line. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:- Review product requirements and define system architecture to meet the requirements.- Will be the owner of product system definition for all SPBU products.- Will participate in technical discussions with customer to present strengths of product architecture.- Review all new designs and implementations to ensure minimal deviation from existing architecture.- Defines, constantly reviews, and differentiates the feature sets of the entire product line and individual products active in the product life cycle.- Provide input for developing compelling and comprehensive product collateral to support SPBU Marketing and Sales teams for pre-sales and post-sales activities. Collateral includes Datasheets, Product Briefs/Slicks, White Papers, Case Studies, Product Presentations, and when needed, Videos.- Takes the role as internal expert as well as external spokesperson and evangelist for SPBU Products architecture.- Working closely with the software team, help develop a strong patent portfolio.- Provide technical leadership in responding to RFIs and RFPs.- Take high level feature requirements from marketing teams and customers and write detailed feature specifications and system architecture for the software team.- Work closely with partners to define architecture and testable requirements for taking new products and features to market.
benefits: WHAT IS BEING OFFERED:- Very competitive base salary- 30% bonus structure, guaranteed, annually.- Significant stake in equity/stock options.- Full benefits package along with many perks.- Opportunity for Executive-level advancement and career leverage.- World renowned leadership, mentorship and a very attractive culture/working environment.
refined_description:
**Senior Systems Engineering Manager, Strategic Product Architecture**

Our organization is at the forefront of innovation, defining the next generation of connectivity solutions for the Service Provider market. We seek an exceptionally talented and visionary Senior Systems Engineering Manager to spearhead the strategic architectural definition of our entire product portfolio. This pivotal role will define the foundational blueprint across hardware, firmware, and software domains, ensuring unparalleled performance, scalability, and market relevance.

You will be instrumental in shaping the future of our offerings, translating strategic vision into tangible architectural frameworks and representing our pioneering approach to key internal and external stakeholders.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Architectural Vision & Ownership:** Hold ultimate accountability for the comprehensive system architecture across all Service Provider Business Unit (SPBU) products, translating complex market demands into groundbreaking, scalable, and defensible solutions.
*   **Strategic Blueprint Development:** Drive the development and meticulous maintenance of foundational functional specifications, comprehensive technical presentations, and impactful responses to high-stakes RFPs, solidifying our competitive advantage.
*   **Cross-Functional Synergy:** Serve as the nexus of collaboration, deeply integrating with Product Line Management, pioneering R&D, agile Hardware and Software development teams, and strategic ODM partners to ensure unparalleled architectural cohesion and accelerated market success.
*   **Design & Implementation Oversight:** Provide authoritative architectural oversight for all new designs and implementations, ensuring strict adherence to our high standards of innovation, integrity, and future-proof scalability.
*   **Market Differentiation:** Act as the primary architect of product differentiation, continuously refining and expanding feature sets to secure unparalleled competitive advantage and market leadership.
*   **Thought Leadership & Advocacy:** Shape and direct the creation of transformative product collateral, amplifying our market presence and empowering sales and marketing initiatives with unparalleled technical depth. Serve as the definitive internal authority and a charismatic external evangelist, shaping industry discourse and cementing our reputation for groundbreaking architectural excellence.
*   **Intellectual Property Cultivation:** Collaborate intimately with our world-class software teams to cultivate a robust, defensible intellectual property portfolio that underpins future innovation and market leadership.
*   **Strategic Client Engagement:** Engage directly with executive-level clients and strategic stakeholders, articulating our architectural vision and competitive advantage with compelling clarity.
*   **Opportunity Capture:** Lead strategic technical responses to high-value RFIs and RFPs, crafting persuasive architectural propositions that secure significant new business opportunities.
*   **Translational Engineering:** Translate ambitious market and customer requirements into meticulous, actionable feature specifications and comprehensive system architecture blueprints for our engineering teams, ensuring flawless execution of strategic initiatives.
*   **Partner Ecosystem Enablement:** Forge highly collaborative alliances with strategic partners, co-defining revolutionary architectures and rigorous, testable requirements to accelerate the launch of pioneering products and features into global markets.

title: Technician Instrument & Controls
description: Deweyville, Texas, United States · Maintenance · NR042114TIDESCRIPTIONTechnician Instrument & ControlsLocation Deweyville, TXCategory: MaintenanceType: Full Time Hourly# Openings: 1Details About this Career Opportunity:Overview:Company Profile:We deliver cleaner and smarter energy choices for our customers, backed by the nation’s largest independent power generation portfolio of fossil fuel, nuclear, solar and wind facilities. A Fortune 500 company is challenging the U.S. energy industry by becoming the largest developer of solar power, building the first privately-funded electric vehicle charging infrastructure, and providing customers with the most advanced smart energy solutions to better manage their energy use. In addition to 47,000 megawatts of generation capacity, enough to supply nearly 40 million homes, our retail electricity providers serve more than two million customers.GENERAL SUMMARYThe Instrumentation Controls and Electrical Technician (IC&E) is responsible for the maintenance and repair of all instruments, control systems and electrical equipment in the power plant and the associated facilities. The IC&E Technician performs work of high skill in the inspection repair, testing, adjustment, installation and removal of all electronic and electrical power plant equipment and systems.PRIMARY FUNCTIONS- Safely perform preventive and corrective maintenance on all plant equipment, systems, and emergency backup systems.- Maintain complete equipment files, logs, and drawings for all designated equipment.- Assist in maintaining and controlling spare parts inventory to maintain plant reliability. Assist in physical inventories.- Participate in the administrative maintenance of the plant operating manuals, technical references, prints and diagrams and preventive/predictive maintenance records.- Inspect repair, install and remove all types of motors, generators, transformers, switches, control equipment, wiring, electrical signal and communication systems, and storage batteries, and work with electrical systems up to and including 4160 volts.- Conduct trouble shooting and analysis on DCS, PLC and GE Mark VI turbine control equipment.- Maintain all plant instrumentation and electrical test equipment.- Fully support and participate in NAES Safety and Regulatory Compliance Programs.- Complete other tasks as assigned by the Maintenance Manager or the Plant Manager.SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITYThe IC&E Technician operates from established and well-known procedures under minimum supervision, performing duties independently with only general direction given. Decisions are made within prescribed operating and casualty procedures and guidelines. The ICE Technician encounters recurring work situations of high complexity, with occasional variations from the norm.The IC&E Technician must perform work in a safe manner resulting in no accidents, in compliance with all environmental permits at all times. The ICE Technician must effectively communicate information to supervision and fellow plant personnel, relative to the condition of the plant equipment and performance, and provide suggestions for plant improvements. The ICE Technician must perform duties in such a way to result in an optimum cost-benefit ratio.The IC&E Technician may also be assigned the additional responsibility of Maintenance Coordinator/Planner for the site. This is a collateral assignment given to a selected maintenance department technician to assist the Operations and Maintenance Manager with the routine planning and coordination of the site equipment maintenance.The duties include:- The planning and review of the preventative, predictive and pro-active type maintenance.- A more in-depth knowledge and ability to use the CMMS system to provide the necessary review and planning to support the O&M Manager in weekly work routines.- Ability to provide the cognitive coordinated efforts necessary to ensure that weekly routines and preventative maintenance are scheduled and documented as complete when the respective maintenance technician indicates that the work has been performed.- Provide the coordination efforts necessary in support of allowing the O&M Manager to provide the necessary supervision and direction of the maintenance technicians.All employees have the responsibility to both the customer and their co-workers to do the job right the first time and to ensure the customers' needs are being met.
benefits: BENEFITSwe are a team of almost 8,000 employees who help power almost 40 million homes and have more than 2 million residential and business customers across the country. Together, we are powering progress every day—from California to Texas and New Jersey to Arizona.Compensation will be determined at a competitive rate and based off your level of experience and aptitude to grow with the company and department.  Please inquire about detailed benefits package information and other compensation package components. Qualified candidates please apply to this opportunity directly.  Please direct all correspondence to Darren Lawson VP of Recruiting at #EMAIL_395225df8eed70288fc67310349d63d49d5f2ca6bc14dbb5dcbf9296069ad88c# | #PHONE_70128aad0c118273b0c2198a08d528591b932924e165b6a8d1272a6f9e2763d1#
refined_description:
**Senior Instrumentation & Control Systems Specialist**

**Location:** Deweyville, Texas, United States

**Category:** Engineering & Operations

**Type:** Full-Time, Salaried

**Job ID:** NR042114TIDESCRIPTION (will remove this ID, it's an internal reference)

**About Our Organization:**

We are a Fortune 500 trailblazer at the forefront of the global energy transformation, shaping a cleaner, smarter, and more sustainable future. As the nation's largest independent power generation portfolio, encompassing cutting-edge fossil fuel, nuclear, solar, and wind assets, we are redefining industry benchmarks. Our visionary initiatives include pioneering the largest solar development in the U.S., establishing the first privately-funded electric vehicle charging infrastructure, and delivering advanced smart energy solutions that empower over two million customers. Join a team dedicated to innovation, responsible for over 47,000 megawatts of generation capacity, impacting nearly 40 million homes, and driving unparalleled progress in the energy sector.

**Role Overview:**

We are seeking an exceptionally skilled and proactive Senior Instrumentation & Control Systems Specialist to assume a pivotal role within our Deweyville power generation facility. This position is central to ensuring the continuous operational integrity and peak performance of our sophisticated power plant infrastructure. The ideal candidate will leverage advanced expertise in instrumentation, control systems, and electrical equipment to sustain the high-reliability demands of our complex energy production environment. This role offers an unparalleled opportunity to contribute directly to the stability and efficiency of critical national energy assets.

**Core Responsibilities:**

*   Execute advanced preventive and corrective maintenance strategies on all core plant equipment, critical systems, and emergency backup infrastructure to ensure seamless functionality.
*   Maintain meticulous and comprehensive documentation, including equipment files, detailed logs, and schematics, serving as a custodian of essential technical information.
*   Strategically manage and optimize spare parts inventories, ensuring optimal stock levels for uninterrupted plant reliability and cost-efficiency.
*   Contribute to the administrative excellence of plant operating manuals, technical references, and precision-engineered prints and diagrams, supporting robust preventive and predictive maintenance programs.
*   Perform intricate inspection, repair, installation, and removal procedures on a diverse range of electrical components, including motors, generators, transformers, switchgear, control apparatus, sophisticated wiring systems, and high-voltage electrical circuits up to and including 4160 volts.
*   Conduct expert-level diagnostics, troubleshooting, and analytical assessments on cutting-edge Distributed Control Systems (DCS), Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), and GE Mark VI turbine control platforms.
*   Calibrate, validate, and meticulously maintain all plant instrumentation and specialized electrical test equipment to uphold precision and accuracy standards.
*   Champion and rigorously adhere to all industry-leading safety protocols and stringent regulatory compliance programs, fostering a culture of unwavering commitment to safety excellence.
*   Engage in dynamic, high-impact projects and initiatives as directed by Maintenance and Plant Leadership, contributing to broader operational objectives.

**Scope of Influence and Professional Growth:**

The Senior Instrumentation & Control Systems Specialist operates with significant autonomy, empowered to navigate complex technical challenges and make critical decisions within established operational frameworks. This role demands a high degree of independent judgment and an exceptional capacity for problem-solving in recurring situations of elevated complexity, with occasional novel variations.

Success in this role is measured by an unblemished safety record, consistent environmental compliance, and the ability to proactively identify and implement innovative solutions that enhance plant performance and optimize resource utilization. The Specialist will be instrumental in fostering a culture of open communication, providing invaluable insights to leadership and peers, and actively shaping continuous improvement initiatives.

Exceptional performers may be identified for an accelerated growth trajectory, including the potential to assume a collateral assignment as a Maintenance Coordinator/Planner. This expanded responsibility entails strategic oversight of preventative, predictive, and proactive maintenance planning, leveraging advanced Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS) to drive weekly work routines and ensure the seamless coordination of maintenance activities, further solidifying their impact on enterprise-wide operational efficiency.

All team members are integral to upholding our unwavering commitment to precision, quality, and delivering unparalleled value to our customers and stakeholders.

refined_description:
**Director of Engineering, Applications | San Francisco, CA**

Join a truly visionary and rapidly expanding organization that is redefining its industry landscape. We are a collective of highly distinguished, interdisciplinary minds, driven by a shared ambition to deliver unparalleled product experiences. Our dynamic and intellectually stimulating environment fosters groundbreaking innovation, bringing together diverse specialties to pioneer solutions that resonate globally.

**In this transformative role, you will:**

*   Inspire and lead a high-performing team of world-class engineers, fostering a culture of excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement.
*   Champion synergistic collaboration with Product, Design, and Reliability counterparts to architect and deploy highly scalable, robust products. These foundational solutions empower our clientele to execute critical business and strategic risk decisions with absolute precision and profound insight.

refined_description:
**Director of Quality Assurance & Site Operations (Cable Solutions)**

**About the Opportunity:**
Join a pioneering team at the forefront of broadband innovation, where your expertise will directly shape the future of connectivity. We are seeking an accomplished and dynamic leader to champion quality assurance for our cutting-edge Cable product portfolio. This pivotal role within our Service Provider Engineering group transcends traditional QA, offering a unique opportunity to drive strategic product excellence while also overseeing critical operational infrastructure. Our solutions are integral to enhancing global communication, impacting millions of users through sophisticated Home Gateway, IPTV, and Voice over IP (VoIP) services delivered by leading Multiple System Operators (MSOs). Your contributions will encompass technologies such as DOCSIS, PacketCable, PPPoX, DNS/DHCP, IP, SIP, IGMP, 802.11 Wireless, Ethernet, VPN, and advanced Firewall systems.

**The Role:**
As the Director of Quality Assurance & Site Operations, you will be the linchpin ensuring both unparalleled product quality and the operational fluidity of our specialized Cable lab environment. This comprehensive leadership position demands a strategic thinker with hands-on technical acumen, capable of cultivating a high-performing team and fostering a world-class testing and operational ecosystem. Your ultimate success will be measured by seamless customer certification and the uncompromising quality of our broadband offerings.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic QA Leadership:**
    *   Define, implement, and continuously refine a robust, scalable quality assurance strategy for all Cable CPE products, ensuring rigorous adherence to major North American MSO requirements and international standards.
    *   Lead, mentor, and expand a team of expert Test Engineers, cultivating a culture of innovation, precision, and continuous improvement.
    *   Oversee the comprehensive test lifecycle, from meticulous test plan development and automation strategy to defect tracking, resolution, and regression validation with global development teams.
    *   Drive cross-functional engagement with product, engineering, and sales teams to align QA initiatives with business objectives and market demands.
    *   Spearhead product qualification processes with customer QA labs, translating complex client requirements into actionable test cases and ensuring seamless integration into master test plans.
    *   Provide incisive analysis and comprehensive status reports, utilizing key metrics to articulate product maturity and testing progress to executive stakeholders.
    *   Contribute strategic insights for product documentation, knowledge bases, and advanced technical support escalations, collaborating with service provider operations to diagnose and resolve complex field issues.
    *   Evaluate emerging technologies and reference designs, proactively integrating new industry standards into the lab’s testing capabilities.

*   **Lab & Operational Excellence:**
    *   Establish, maintain, and continually optimize the state-of-the-art Cable Lab, ensuring it remains at the vanguard of technology with up-to-date firmware revisions, equipment, and robust processes for maximum operational efficiency and security.
    *   Implement and enforce stringent lab usage protocols, ensuring a clean, safe, and highly productive environment conducive to peak performance.
    *   Assume comprehensive oversight for the entire office site, including managing inbound and outbound correspondence, optimizing supply chain for office essentials, overseeing security badge protocols, and ensuring strict compliance with all safety and legal regulations.
    *   Act as the primary liaison with external vendors, corporate facilities, and HR teams to guarantee seamless operations and an optimal working environment for all local staff and high-profile customer visits.

**Required Qualifications:**

*   Proven leadership experience in Quality Assurance within the telecommunications or broadband industry.
*   Deep technical proficiency in DOCSIS, PacketCable, IPTV, VoIP, and related networking technologies.
*   Demonstrated success in building, leading, and mentoring high-performance technical teams.
*   Exceptional strategic planning, organizational, and problem-solving abilities.
*   Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.

Demonstrated ability to use lightweight processes to improve engineering results.Can stay on top of and apply the latest technology trends and engineering processes for the organization.

refined_description:
**Director of Engineering | HMA Security Products**

**Location:** San Jose, California

**About NETGEAR:**
At NETGEAR, we are at the forefront of innovation, pioneering the future of connected living and enterprise across the globe. As a NASDAQ-listed industry leader, we design, develop, and market groundbreaking technology solutions that redefine networking, storage, and security for millions of businesses and consumers worldwide. Our unwavering commitment to excellence and user-centric design fuels our extensive portfolio, distributed across 27,000 retail locations and supported by a vast network of 37,000 value-added resellers in 25 countries. Join a vibrant ecosystem where ingenuity thrives, and your contributions shape the digital landscape.

**The Opportunity:**
We are seeking a visionary and highly accomplished **Director of Engineering** for our critical HMA Security Products division. Reporting directly to the VP of Service Provider Engineering, this pivotal role offers unparalleled scope to strategically lead and drive the successful conception, development, and market deployment of our next-generation security solutions. This is more than a management position; it's an opportunity to architect the future of secure connectivity.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic Leadership:** Provide visionary technical and managerial leadership for a focused, elite team of engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, accountability, and continuous improvement.
*   **Ecosystem Orchestration:** Cultivate, manage, and expand critical strategic alliances with an array of external technology partners, including chipset providers, ODMs, emerging technology startups, and third-party software innovators, to accelerate product realization and market reach.
*   **Roadmap & Architecture:** Collaborate intimately with Product Marketing to define the strategic product roadmap, translating market insights into robust engineering initiatives. Spearhead the determination of optimal engineering approaches, pioneering product architectures, and meticulously planning resource allocation, testing protocols, project timelines, and NPI strategies.
*   **Execution Excellence:** Oversee the seamless execution of complex engineering projects, guiding both internal teams and external partners to consistently achieve and surpass ambitious objectives.
*   **Market Enablement:** Forge strong relationships with key customers and certification bodies to ensure product approval and market acceptance. Work synergistically with Sales and Technical Support teams post-launch to champion unparalleled customer satisfaction and maintain unassailable product quality.

**Candidate Profile:**

*   A distinguished career spanning over 10 years in engineering leadership, with demonstrable success in driving the development of complex communication networking hardware and software solutions, ideally leveraging Test Driven Development principles.
*   Profound technical acumen and thought leadership in Security products, networking protocols (routers, wireless, IP networking), with VoIP experience being a distinct advantage.
*   An established and stellar reputation within the global networking industry, recognized as a credible influencer and innovator.
*   Exceptional prowess in strategic program and project orchestration, with a finely honed ability to proactively mitigate risks and cultivate robust third-party collaborations.
*   Proven expertise in leveraging global partnerships and external innovation ecosystems to accelerate product realization and expand market reach.
*   A natural talent magnet, adept at cultivating a high-performance culture that attracts, nurtures, and retains elite engineering talent.
*   A trusted advisor whose strategic insights are actively sought by key clients and technology partners, solidifying market leadership.
*   Versatile leadership experience, having successfully navigated both agile, high-growth environments and established, large-scale market leaders (minimum 5 years in each, cumulatively 10+).
*   An exceptional cross-functional collaborator, capable of fostering synergistic relationships across all organizational strata and articulating complex visions with clarity and impact.
*   Unwavering commitment to elevating product quality standards through innovative, adaptive process optimization, driving unparalleled engineering efficiencies.
*   A fervent advocate for technological advancement, continuously integrating cutting-edge trends and pioneering methodologies to maintain our competitive edge.

**Why NETGEAR?**
This is an exceptional opportunity to join a globally recognized leader at a pivotal moment of expansion and innovation. We offer a dynamic, collaborative, and empowering environment where ingenuity is celebrated, and your contributions will have a direct, transformative impact on our global presence. We provide a highly competitive compensation package and an unrivalled growth trajectory for individuals ready to define the next era of connectivity.

**Application Process:**
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their comprehensive resume and a compelling cover letter outlining their alignment with this transformative role. Only applications submitted through our official career portal will be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest; only those selected for an initial interview will be contacted.

**Director, Advanced Security Engineering**

Join a rapidly evolving, industry-leading technology firm at the forefront of digital innovation. We are pioneering transformative solutions that redefine the landscape of network security. This is an unparalleled opportunity to lead a pivotal engineering function and directly influence our strategic trajectory, impacting global markets.

Reporting directly to the Vice President of Service Provider Engineering, the Director of Advanced Security Engineering will assume comprehensive leadership for the end-to-end development, deployment, and lifecycle management of our groundbreaking security product portfolio. This highly strategic role demands not only profound technical acumen but also exceptional leadership in managing both high-performing internal engineering teams and a diverse ecosystem of critical external technology partners, including leading chipset providers, ODMs, emerging technology ventures, and strategic software collaborators.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Orchestrate the holistic engineering roadmap in close collaboration with product marketing, translating visionary concepts into robust, market-leading solutions.
*   Drive the architectural vision, technology selection, intricate resource planning, rigorous testing protocols, project scheduling, detailed costing, and seamless New Product Introduction (NPI) planning, ensuring alignment with our aggressive growth objectives.
*   Provide decisive leadership and expert guidance to an elite team of engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, excellence, and continuous improvement.
*   Cultivate and manage high-value relationships with strategic technology partners, ensuring optimal collaboration and delivering unparalleled solutions.
*   Champion rigorous customer engagement through product certification and approval processes, and sustain exemplary product quality and customer satisfaction post-launch, in partnership with sales and technical support.

**Candidate Profile:**

We are seeking a visionary engineering leader with a distinguished track record of shaping the future of network security.

*   Minimum of 10 years of progressive engineering leadership and strategic management experience within the communications networking hardware and software domain, ideally demonstrating proficiency with advanced development methodologies.
*   Proven expertise in Security products, including but not limited to advanced routing, wireless protocols, and IP networking architectures; VoIP experience is a distinct advantage.
*   Demonstrated ability to inspire, attract, develop, and retain top-tier engineering talent, fostering an environment of unparalleled achievement.
*   Exceptional proficiency in complex project and program management, adept at navigating intricate risk landscapes and managing multifaceted third-party engagements.
*   A recognized authority and highly credible voice within the networking industry, capable of influencing key customers and technology partners at the executive level.
*   Possesses a unique blend of agility honed in dynamic, high-growth smaller enterprises (5+ years experience) coupled with the disciplined execution characteristic of established market leaders (5+ years experience).
*   A consummate team player with superior cross-functional collaboration skills, capable of articulate and impactful communication across all organizational tiers.
*   Unwavering commitment to continuous product quality enhancement and the implementation of streamlined, effective engineering processes.
*   Proactive engagement with emerging technological trends and a demonstrated capability to integrate cutting-edge innovations into organizational practices.

**Why Join Us?**

This is an unparalleled opportunity to contribute to truly disruptive technology within a culture that champions innovation, rewards excellence, and offers a robust platform for professional growth. We offer an exceptional, highly competitive compensation and benefits package reflective of your leadership and impact.

**Application Process:**

Interested candidates are invited to submit their comprehensive resume and a compelling cover letter detailing their relevant experience and leadership philosophy through our secure online portal. Only qualified applicants will be contacted for further consideration.

**Software Architect**
**Location:** San Jose, CA

**Role Overview:**
We are seeking a visionary and highly accomplished Software Architect to join our Service Provider Business Unit (SPBU). This pivotal role demands a leader who can orchestrate the strategic direction and evolution of our software architecture, ensuring our solutions not only meet but anticipate market demands. The successful candidate will be instrumental in shaping our technological future, driving innovation, and solidifying our position as an undisputed market leader within a dynamic and rapidly evolving landscape.

**Key Contributions:**

*   Define, evangelize, and implement a transformative software strategy for the SPBU, aligning with overarching corporate objectives and market opportunities.
*   Assume stewardship of the operating system platform roadmap, guiding its development and successful delivery across all supported platforms.
*   Actively engage with leading industry forums and standards bodies, exerting influence to shape future specifications and ensure our strategic alignment with emerging technologies.
*   Pioneer initiatives that establish and maintain our thought leadership within the marketplace, fostering cross-functional consensus and successful execution across the organization.
*   Continuously analyze, innovate, and strategically differentiate the feature sets across our entire product portfolio, optimizing for competitive advantage and long-term viability.
*   Serve as a primary technical authority and compelling external evangelist for SPBU products, contributing influential articles to technical and trade publications, engaging with industry analysts, and representing the company at high-profile events.
*   Collaborate profoundly with cross-functional teams, including Product Line Management, R&D, Marketing Communications, and Global Sales, to ensure architectural coherence and strategic success for our product lines.
*   Drive the conceptualization and development of a robust patent portfolio, fostering a culture of innovation and protecting our intellectual property.
*   Provide decisive technical leadership in the formulation of responses to critical Requests for Information (RFIs) and Requests for Proposals (RFPs).
*   Translate high-level strategic requirements derived from market insights and customer needs into meticulously detailed, architecturally sound specifications for our engineering teams.
*   Forge and nurture strategic partnerships, collaborating on joint architectural definitions and accelerating the market introduction of groundbreaking products and features.

refined_description:
**UST Testing Technician | Bakersfield, CA**

A rapidly expanding leader in petroleum infrastructure and environmental compliance solutions is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented UST Testing Technician to join our specialized field operations team. This pivotal role involves ensuring the integrity and regulatory compliance of critical petroleum storage infrastructure across our regional network. You will operate within a dynamic and fast-paced environment, contributing directly to safety standards and operational excellence.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Conduct comprehensive diagnostic testing, calibration, and preventative maintenance of Underground Storage Tanks (USTs), dispensing systems, and associated equipment at various client sites.
*   Execute maintenance and repair tasks with precision within confined space environments, strictly adhering to all safety protocols and industry best practices.
*   Perform accurate data collection and maintain meticulous field documentation for all testing and service activities, ensuring compliance records are up-to-date.
*   Provide collaborative support to senior technicians on complex operational challenges and assist in emergent situations, demonstrating adaptability and problem-solving acumen.
*   Manage a flexible schedule to facilitate extensive travel throughout the Bakersfield region and neighboring areas, meeting operational demands with efficiency.

**Qualifications:**

*   Proven experience in field service operations, with a strong emphasis on USTs, fuel systems, and general industrial maintenance.
*   Demonstrated proficiency and a strong safety record in working within confined spaces.
*   Exceptional mechanical aptitude and a meticulous approach to technical tasks.
*   Highly organized with strong documentation skills and attention to detail.
*   Possession of a valid California Driver's License with an impeccable driving record is mandatory.
*   Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team in a physically demanding role.

**What We Offer:**

*   A competitive compensation package commensurate with experience and impact.
*   Significant opportunities for professional growth and skill enhancement within a critical and evolving industry sector.
*   A collaborative and supportive work environment committed to innovation and operational excellence.
*   Access to cutting-edge diagnostic tools and industry best practices.

**Application Process:**

We invite qualified candidates to submit their application exclusively through our designated online portal. Please refrain from direct phone calls or unsolicited emails, as only applications submitted via our official channel will be reviewed. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in adhering to this process. Recruitment agencies are kindly requested not to contact us regarding this position.

refined_description:
**Process Engineer**

We are seeking a highly motivated and accomplished Process Engineer to join our independent refining operation. This pivotal role offers a unique opportunity to directly influence operational excellence and strategic growth within a dynamic, agile environment.

The successful candidate will be instrumental in driving advanced process engineering initiatives across various unit operations, contributing significantly to our core business objectives and future expansion.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Provide expert process engineering support, optimizing refinery unit performance and ensuring operational efficiency.
*   Develop and implement innovative engineering solutions to complex operational challenges, enhancing productivity and reliability.
*   Lead and direct comprehensive Process Safety Management (PSM) programs for critical refinery projects, including robust P&ID reviews, meticulous Hazard Analyses (PHAs), seamless Management of Change (MOCs), and thorough Pre-Startup Safety Reviews (PSSRs).
*   Initiate and oversee high-value capital investment projects from conceptualization through commissioning, including detailed economic justifications, scope definition, and stakeholder alignment.
*   Prepare precise process design packages, comprehensive specifications, technical drawings, and detailed bid documents to facilitate procurement, construction, and maintenance activities.
*   Provide strategic oversight and technical guidance to external engineering firms and construction teams, ensuring adherence to project specifications and safety standards.
*   Champion best practices in safety, environmental stewardship, and regulatory compliance across all process recommendations and project implementations.

This role demands a multi-faceted professional who thrives in an environment where their contributions have a direct, measurable impact on the enterprise's success. Significant opportunities for professional advancement and leadership are inherent within our growth-oriented structure.

**UST Systems Technician | Bakersfield, CA**

**A Nationally Recognized Leader in Petroleum Infrastructure Solutions** is actively seeking a highly skilled and dedicated **UST Systems Technician** to join our dynamic field operations team in Bakersfield, CA. This pivotal role is essential for maintaining the operational integrity and regulatory compliance of critical fuel storage and dispensing systems across our diverse portfolio of sites.

**About the Role:**
We are searching for a proactive and adaptable professional capable of thriving in a challenging, rapid-response environment. The successful candidate will be instrumental in ensuring the peak performance and safety of underground storage tanks (USTs) and associated fueling infrastructure. This position demands a commitment to excellence, a keen eye for detail, and a robust understanding of industry best practices.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Execute comprehensive on-site diagnostics, preventive maintenance, and corrective repairs on UST systems, pumps, and related petroleum infrastructure.
*   Conduct meticulous inspections and ensure adherence to all federal, state, and local environmental regulations, including confined space entry protocols.
*   Interpret technical schematics and perform advanced troubleshooting to resolve complex system anomalies efficiently.
*   Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and fellow technicians, providing expert assistance in emergent situations to minimize operational downtime.
*   Document all service activities, findings, and resolutions accurately and meticulously, contributing to robust operational records.
*   Maintain open and professional communication with site managers and internal stakeholders regarding service progress and system status.

**Qualifications:**

*   Proven experience (typically 3+ years) in the maintenance, testing, and repair of underground storage tanks (USTs) and fuel dispensing equipment.
*   Demonstrated proficiency in working within confined space environments, with a strong commitment to stringent safety procedures.
*   In-depth understanding of relevant environmental regulations (e.g., EPA, state environmental agencies) and industry standards.
*   Possession of a valid driver's license and a verifiable clean driving record are mandatory. Extensive regional travel is an essential component of this role.
*   Exceptional problem-solving capabilities and the ability to operate autonomously while also excelling in a collaborative team setting.
*   Relevant industry certifications (e.g., ICC UST certifications) are highly advantageous.

**Compensation & Benefits:**
We offer a highly competitive compensation package commensurate with experience, a comprehensive benefits program, and significant opportunities for continuous professional development and career advancement within a rapidly evolving and critical industry sector.

**To Apply:**
Please submit your detailed resume and a compelling cover letter outlining your relevant experience and qualifications to be considered for this impactful opportunity.

**Company Overview:**
Refined Resources is a premier talent acquisition firm specializing in strategic placements across the dynamic Oil & Energy sector. We are currently partnering with a globally recognized, industry-leading enterprise to identify a highly skilled Plant Operations Specialist for their advanced facility in Bakersfield, California.

**Role Summary:**
Join a pivotal operational team at the forefront of energy production. We are seeking an accomplished Plant Operations Specialist to contribute to the seamless and efficient functioning of our client's critical Bakersfield facilities. This role is instrumental in ensuring peak performance, technical integrity, and continuous optimization across a diverse range of operational systems, including advanced crude oil processing, water management, high-pressure steam generation, and cutting-edge vapor recovery units.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Process Optimization & Control:** Strategically operate and optimize complex systems for crude oil dehydration to achieve stringent quality benchmarks. Execute precise flow diversion and isolation protocols for planned interventions and system enhancements.
*   **Performance Monitoring & Diagnostics:** Conduct advanced surveillance of critical operational parameters via SCADA systems and on-site assessments. Proactively identify, diagnose, and resolve process anomalies to uphold continuous operational integrity and maximize output efficiency.
*   **Technical Support & Asset Management:** Provide comprehensive technical and operational support for the entire asset lifecycle, including steam generation, water management (softening, disposal), and sophisticated vapor recovery units. Oversee the preparation and execution of intricate maintenance, repair, and installation initiatives.
*   **Strategic Planning & Execution:** Develop and implement detailed operational job plans, ensuring timely and secure execution. Manage and coordinate specialized third-party contractors and internal maintenance teams, fostering collaborative synergy for project success.
*   **Reporting & Data Analysis:** Perform meticulous data acquisition from plant readings and translate complex operational data into actionable daily and weekly performance reports, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
*   **Safety & Compliance Leadership:** Champion an unwavering commitment to HSE (Health, Safety, and Environment) excellence. Administer and enforce robust safety permitting systems, ensuring stringent adherence to all corporate and regulatory guidelines within a hydrocarbon environment.
*   **Operational Excellence Initiatives:** Drive continuous improvement efforts across all facets of plant operations, contributing to the achievement of ambitious production targets and sustainability goals.

**Qualifications:**

*   Proven expertise in the operation, troubleshooting, and optimization of diverse oilfield production assets and integrated systems.
*   Demonstrated proficiency with SCADA systems and comprehensive MS Office Suite applications (including advanced Excel capabilities) for data analysis and reporting.
*   Exceptional analytical and diagnostic capabilities, with a proactive approach to identifying and mitigating operational risks.
*   Superior communication and interpersonal skills, fostering effective collaboration within dynamic team environments and with external stakeholders.
*   Unwavering commitment to industry-leading HSE protocols and a thorough understanding of safety practices in hydrocarbon processing environments.
*   A track record of driving operational efficiency and contributing to strategic production objectives.

**UST Testing Technician III**

**Location:** Bakersfield, CA

**Company Overview:**
As a prominent leader in the regional energy sector, our organization is renowned for its extensive network in the retail and wholesale distribution of motor fuels and related petroleum products. We are undergoing strategic expansion, consistently investing in our infrastructure and talent to maintain our standing as an industry innovator. We are currently seeking a highly skilled and dedicated professional to join our elite operations team.

**Role Summary:**
The UST Testing Technician III is a pivotal role, integral to ensuring the operational excellence, safety, and stringent regulatory compliance of our critical underground storage tank (UST) systems and associated retail fueling infrastructure. This position demands a sophisticated understanding of complex mechanical and electronic systems, combined with a meticulous approach to diagnostics, maintenance, and documentation. The successful candidate will play a key role in safeguarding our assets and upholding our unwavering commitment to environmental stewardship.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   Execute comprehensive diagnostics, precision repairs, and proactive preventative maintenance on advanced retail fueling systems, including dispensers, pumps, piping, control units, and advanced leak detection systems.
*   Conduct thorough calibration, testing, and system integrity checks on all UST components in strict adherence to federal, state, and local environmental regulations (e.g., EPA 40 CFR Part 280, CARB, API standards).
*   Utilize state-of-the-art testing equipment and methodologies to identify and resolve complex technical anomalies, minimizing operational downtime and optimizing fuel delivery efficiency.
*   Maintain meticulous and comprehensive records of all service activities, inspections, compliance documentation, and system performance data, contributing to our robust operational transparency and audit readiness.
*   Collaborate effectively with site management, regulatory agencies, and third-party vendors to ensure seamless operational continuity, continuous improvement initiatives, and the rapid deployment of innovative solutions.
*   Provide expert technical guidance and mentorship to junior technicians or site personnel, fostering a culture of operational excellence and best practices across our facilities.

**Qualifications:**

*   Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated experience in the maintenance, repair, and testing of petroleum dispensing and Underground Storage Tank (UST) systems, preferably within a high-volume retail or commercial environment.
*   Profound understanding of environmental regulations governing UST systems, including leak detection protocols, spill prevention, and overfill protection.
*   Relevant professional certifications (e.g., UST Class A/B Operator, ICC Service Technician, PEI certifications) are highly desirable.
*   Exceptional diagnostic and problem-solving abilities, with a keen eye for detail and a methodical approach to complex technical challenges.
*   Proven ability to work autonomously, manage multiple priorities, and adapt to evolving operational demands in a dynamic environment.
*   Strong commitment to safety protocols, environmental stewardship, and continuous professional development.
*   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of professional interaction with diverse stakeholders, including regulatory bodies and internal teams.

**What We Offer:**

*   A highly competitive compensation package, meticulously designed to recognize and reward expertise.
*   A comprehensive benefits suite, including robust health, dental, and vision insurance, along with a strong retirement savings plan.
*   Significant opportunities for professional development, advanced training, and long-term career progression within a rapidly expanding and strategically vital industry leader.
*   Access to cutting-edge diagnostic tools and technologies, empowering you to perform at the highest level.
*   A collaborative, dynamic, and supportive work environment where your expertise directly contributes to critical operational success and the company's ambitious growth trajectory.

**JOB TITLE: Project Engineer, Capital Programs**

We are seeking a highly driven and results-oriented Project Engineer to join our distinguished Capital Programs division. This pivotal role offers a unique opportunity to lead and significantly contribute to high-impact, strategic infrastructure projects that underpin our operational excellence and future growth within the energy sector.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic Project Leadership:** Spearhead the comprehensive lifecycle management of assigned capital projects, from initial conceptualization and rigorous feasibility assessment through detailed design, procurement, construction oversight, commissioning, and final close-out, ensuring seamless integration and optimal performance.
*   **Engineering & Design Authority:** Serve as the primary technical authority for project-specific engineering, meticulously developing detailed specifications, comprehensive drawings, robust bid packages, and in-depth quotation analyses essential for the acquisition, construction, and strategic enhancement of our refinery and petrochemical facilities.
*   **Contractor Oversight & Performance:** Provide expert supervision and strategic guidance to multi-disciplinary contract engineering firms and construction teams, ensuring uncompromised adherence to project scope, timeline, budget, and our stringent quality and safety standards.
*   **Performance & Delivery Excellence:** Drive the successful realization of all project objectives, consistently delivering initiatives on schedule, within budgetary parameters, and in strict conformance with cutting-edge design specifications and industry best practices.
*   **Operational Integration & Stewardship:** Champion the proactive integration of advanced safety protocols and comprehensive environmental stewardship principles into every phase of engineering design and project execution, fostering a culture of sustainable operational integrity and responsible innovation.

**Qualifications:**

*   Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering from a reputable, accredited institution is required.
*   A proven track record of 3 to 10 years of progressive experience within the refining or petrochemical industries, with demonstrated success in managing significant capital projects.
*   Exceptional analytical acumen, problem-solving capabilities, and a commitment to precision engineering.

Opportunities for rapid career progression and involvement in groundbreaking, globally impactful initiatives are inherent to this demanding yet highly rewarding position.

refined_description:
**Process Safety Management Consultant – Senior Level**

As a leading global firm at the forefront of engineering, project management, design, and regulatory compliance, we are dedicated to delivering innovative, comprehensive solutions that drive unparalleled safety and operational excellence for our clients worldwide. We are currently seeking a highly skilled and results-driven Process Safety Management Consultant to join our dynamic team and significantly contribute to high-impact projects.

This pivotal role offers the opportunity to shape critical safety frameworks and directly influence the operational integrity of complex industrial systems.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*   **Strategic Client Engagement:** Serve as a primary point of contact for key clients, providing expert consultation and crafting bespoke recommendations for the advanced implementation and optimization of Process Safety Management (PSM) systems.
*   **Advanced Risk Assessment Leadership:** Lead and orchestrate sophisticated hazard identification and risk assessment methodologies, including comprehensive HAZOP studies, What-If analyses, and meticulous checklist evaluations, to proactively mitigate operational risks.
*   **Operational Protocol Development:** Design, develop, and refine critical operating procedures and comprehensive documentation, ensuring robust safety protocols and enhancing overall operational integrity across diverse client portfolios.
*   **Regulatory Compliance Excellence:** Champion meticulous coordination to ensure unwavering adherence to Process Safety Information (PSI) requirements, maintaining the highest standards of regulatory compliance and industry best practices.
*   **Change Management Facilitation:** Drive the efficient facilitation of Management of Change (MOC) and Pre-Startup Safety Review (PSSR) processes, ensuring seamless transitions and uncompromising safety standards for all operational modifications and new installations.
*   **Performance Analytics & Improvement:** Conduct rigorous Safety Objective Analysis (SOA), delivering insightful evaluations and strategic recommendations that directly influence safety performance metrics and continuous improvement initiatives across client operations.

**About You:**

You are a proactive, highly motivated professional with a deep understanding of process safety principles, eager to leverage your expertise in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where your contributions have a tangible impact. You thrive on solving complex challenges and are committed to fostering a culture of safety excellence.

Join us and become an integral part of a forward-thinking team committed to pioneering solutions in industrial safety and regulatory compliance.

**Application Process:**

Interested candidates are invited to submit a detailed resume and cover letter outlining their qualifications and relevant experience.
